description: There are a bunch of restaurants in Hayes Valley but this is without a doubt THE BEST burger spot in town. So so so good. I always order their California burger which has the patty, lettuce, tomato, avocado, onions, pickles and cheese on a soft hamburger bun. They also come with a side order of fries. They also have wings and other things on the menu. Their potato salad's also super delicious to add on. Plenty of canned sodas and Snapple for drinks. Content every time.
author: Sahar N.

description:
I've always liked their food.  Unfortunately I will not cater their business any longer.  

My food ordered thru Eat24 arrived missing items that I paid for.  Called the restaurant and spoke with a woman named Amy(sp?) and she stated she could not refund me the money.  So I then called Eat24 and asked them to intervene.  They replied that restaurant refused to refund me.

The owner's name is John.

Shameful business practice.  I wonder if they do this all the time?  Maybe the city should investigate.
author: Patrick N.

description:
Went to this place before the ballet because every where else in Hayes Valley was packed and too busy.

Quick and easy. Love it! Order any of the burgers. It's a solid joint. Don't expected anything fancy or outstanding, like many others have stated, it's just a burger place.
author: Mimi T.

description: Good burger place with nice juicy beef patties. Their fries aren't bad either. I've tried their wings and didn't like them too much. Small grab and go place.  Not really any burger places like it in the area.
author: Anthony W.

description: Just find another spot, super expensive and it doesn't taste good. Parking is awful so you end up driving around the block a few times then get screwed over with mediocre food
author: Karah G.

description:
What happened DD??  I miss the fresh chips and burgers you used to have.  They were PERFECT.  Please bring them back.

Their patties are smaller now, and the bun/everything isn't as tasty.  I used to want to inhale the whole thing in 4 seconds but didn't get that sensation this time.

The fries looked orange and tasted odd.  We think it might be a combo of previously frozen potatoes, overused oil, and MSG.  We both got a weird headache that lingered for the rest of evening after we ate.  I've been eating pretty clean, so I'm more sensitive to MSG and additives, but my taste buds are astute as ever.  Bummer.
author: Nanemone T.

description: We came upon this little hole in the wall gem as we were looking for something to eat before going to the symphony. It's a very tiny little place but the flavor surely makes up for the size. The burgers were big and juicy, like run down your fingers juicy! The fries were nice and crispy on the outside & soft on the inside, perfection! The staff is very kind and helpful. It's definitely a neighborhood joint. The cherry on top was the fact that they sold Mitchell's Ice cream, so we got a scoop before we left. This is definitely a must try and me and my hubby will certainly be coming back.
author: Karina V.

description: Super cozy burger shop with an upstairs dining experience. We came in after searching for parking so we parked a block down and walked. Prices are kinda pricey and drinks are sold separately. I have the California and my friend got the double decker. Both filling and noticeably fresh! Only reason not a 5 Star due to order taker eating fries while taking our order lol
author: Suzy V.

description: Just had dinner here with my parents and we LOVE burgers and chicken wings. So I ordered a half dozen salt n pepper wings which were ok, I also ordered a burger with cheese protein style aka wrapped in lettuce and it was BOMB. I  didn't know that the burger came with fries I should have ordered veggies on the side but all in all it was really good and I would def come back
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
It's a typical takeout fast food joint with a sit down restaurant price, but hey, it's SF! I got the cheeseburger and fries which ended up being $12. The cheeseburger was a typical burger...nothing special. Not worth $8 but I was becoming sangry (sad + hungry) and needed food in my system. The fries were definitely those frozen in the bag type of fries, but they at least fry it to crisp perfection. 

It's located right next to the motel, and it seems like most of it's business comes from UberEats/Postmates. Unless there's a deal, then I probably would not recommend trying it. In n out would satisfy the same craving at a lower price.
author: Iris A.

description:
This place is pretty unremarkable for a $10 burger.

It is in an interesting spot and the people were nice. But the burger was just OK. It wasn't bad. It's just your regular greasy burger joint. I had the one with avocado in it, but I don't think it helped the cause much. The place was cold and the seating faces the counter which isn't appealing at all. It was a good thing I was just in for a quick bite.

I don't think I will be back to try anything else.
author: Alex K.

description: Ordered to go, didn't get a receipt, and sat down to wait for my food. Food was brought to me and then I headed home. Didn't realize until I got home that I was given the completely wrong order.
author: Johnny C.

description: I love double decker - tiny place with great burgers and great variety. Good prices for the quantity you get!
author: Carla P.

description:
Ordered through UberEATS so can't comment on the service or decor but my wings and potato salad were unbelievably delicious.

The sweet chili wings looked like they'd be way too spicy but was equivalent (in heat) to the McDonald's dipping sauce of the same name.
author: Barack O.

description:
My third time to get lunch from here. This time I called ahead to pick up my order and the guy said it would be ready in 10 minutes, and indeed my order was on time!
Delicious burger and fries! 
Burger bread is good and veggies are fresh. 
Fries are crunchy!!! Mmmm!!!
Only comment might be is that it's pretty pricey.
But meal was worth it!!!
author: Ariene S.

description:
Friendly staff and decent burgers. We tried the garlic fries and they were great, just enough garlic and very crispy. The burgers were OK. 

They have downstairs and upstairs. We sat upstairs where we were the only customers. It is just a hamburger joint, and nothing special about it. 

I just really liked the people behind the counter as they were downright great and helpful.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
2-1/4 stars. Don't get the fish and chips. That's probably obvious, but I went in and then thought maybe the fish wouldn't be quite as bad for me. I was wrong. Worst fish & chips I ever had. Batter like Fried shoe leather. A sliver of Fish somewhere hidden inside. And then they took the chips idea literally not understanding the mean steak fries in England. These were paper thin potato chips. They also had no lemon or vinegar available. With fish & chips on the menu?! That'll teach me not to order Hamburger or try to be a little bit healthy. 

I've had a burger here before. It was the right thing to have after too many beers, and messy and enjoyable. But far from extraordinary. Or worth $8. The bun is too soft and doesn't have great architecture. The beef is good but overcooked and only a quarter pound. The fries are too expensive. 

I really want to like this place because of the grass fed beef and odd location, but it's just not that good. And they should seriously take the fish off the menu. I even asked what kind of fish before I ordered and the guy said I'm not sure but lots of people order it. Foolish foolish people.
author: David A R.

description:
Fugitives must eat here. Or dates who don't want to be seen together. Or heck, make that dates who don't want to see each other. The fluorescent lights make God damn sure of that, along with sticky tables, and a big freezer in the corner upstairs where they store body parts in bad movies. 

The wings are the smallest I've ever seen. The flavor nothing to write home about. Through the course of dinner - if you can call it that - I actually got sad and depressed by the whole scene.

Their only saving grace? The waiter. Warm, efficient, and normal. I hope he escapes soon.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Not gonna lie: I was craving a McDonald's fish filet with cheese (hold the tarter), but on principle, I just couldn't do it. I started looking around frantically for another place to get a fish sandwich. And just FYI- it's not as easy to come by in this city (much to my chagrin). Then I remembered passing this greasy-spoon- looking place while en route somewhere, and figured now is as good a time as any to check it out.

It's located in the Hayes Valley area, in a section of that area that's lost to time, and where you can really get an idea of what Hayes Valley used to be like (not the hipster-chic place it's known to be, but more gritty, and I mean that in a good way). 

The place is small, but 2 levels with room to chow, for those of you hipsters that aren't afraid of sticking around to actually finish your meal (and I digress, this place isn't seedy at all, but I know how you tech bros, gals and other sheltered manchildren with lack of exposure to things under a certain income bracket seem to think...just saying and keeping it real). The staff are really nice and definitely have their regulars (I love places with regulars). I ordered and they double checked my request for no tarter sauce. My order came out in less than 10 minutes and I couldn't wait to feed my craving.

The sandwich was pretty good. Nothing spectacular, but I wasn't expecting spectacular (I was expecting a good fish sandwich that wasn't from said archers place). Price point was reasonable and fries were also delish. All in all, I'm impressed and they earn their place as a keeper in my book! There's no reason why I won't be back at this place when I get a hankering for a good, cheap meal. 

Likes:
-cheap
-fast
-good 

Dislikes:
-delivery was limited (and maybe not in my best interest, so this is probably a good thing)
author: Tracy T.

description:
Came by Double Decker for dinner with a couple of friends on a Weekday evening. Based on the photos previously it seems like a small place but is in an interesting spot. Spotted beside a hotel, it has not a lot of seating. It appears to serve some of the basic options which are done well. Ended up going with some friends to get their different types of wings and ended up getting their Sweet Chili, Teriyaki, Garlic and their Medium wings with a side of their fries.

Sweet Potato Fries - More of an average cut. With a right amount of texture and crisp outside.

Medium Spicy Wings - Not too spicy as other places would call it. More of a mild spice when referencing to a typical sports bar Buffalo wing and more comparable to the spiciness out of a mild Thai entree.

Garlic Wings - Very crispy and very prominent flavor of garlic. Has kind of the profile of pesto when it comes to dryness of the garlic. Overall excellent.
Sweet Chili - Very saucy and flavorful wing. The sauce reminds me of the Thai Sweet Chili sauce used for egg rolls and other fried foods. Simple, but tastes very sweet with an extremely light sense of heat from the chili.
Teriyaki - Good based sauce that resembles Teriyaki well. Especially if you enjoy Teriyaki sauce and wings, this would be for you.

Overall I would recommend this place as it is pretty reasonable for prices for wings and provides other essentials such as burgers, and fries at a decent price. They also have a Happy Hour between 3-6PM here.
author: Frank O.

description:
Delish Delish Delish! The best burger and wings I have had in the city. 
Nothing fancy but delish food.
author: Shruti P.

description: We ordered delivery and it came at a decent time. Ordered garlic wings, sweet potato fries, and fish sandwich. Fish sandwich was good, had some browned avocado tho. Wings were hella dry, had no salt on it, but had a really strong garlic smell...but no taste of garlic. When my friend told me the amount I was disgusted at how expensive this meal was. Would never eat there again or reccomend it.
author: The Foodie C.

description:
To be fair, I didn't get a burger myself, just fries and a beer, but I'd do have a bite of my husband's. 

Burger was fine. Much better than McDonald's. Definitely not gourmet. Bun was too squish in my opinion. Meat was decent but a little pinner. 

Garlic fries were solid. Plenty garlicky. 

They have beer on tap which is good. Only three to choose from. 

Very small spot. Funny tables with a bench on one side inside. 

It was definitely quick, which always good to know. 

Didn't get the wings, so hey maybe they are amazing.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Orderer via postmates and ordered mild buffalo wings and fries.

The buffalo sauce was very very thin so the wings did not have a lot of flavor, and because it was thin, there was a pool of it at the bottom of the carton that the wings were in... I also noticed at the bottom of the carton that the buffalo sauce was really really oily... but I was hungry so I ate them... well a few hours later I noticed a bit of a stomach ache and the food wasn't sitting well with me and *warning* graphic... I just vomitted.  Won't be back here and won't recommend.
author: Alex R.

description:
The manager was rude. The girl at the counter was incompetent. When they forgot to add our drinks, which I didn't mind paying for, they said that there was a $5 minimum charge (which is illegal btw). All in all my order was over  $30 for 2 burgers and fries. They refused to take my payment for 2 canned sodas. When I had enough of the attitude and lack of care, I requested my money back, they refused to issue a refund. The manager said to dispute it with my bank because I wasn't getting a refund from the store. 

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!! Way better restaurants than this in the area.
author: Alex Q.

description:
First I'd like to say I've tried this place before a few years and it was good, so I said I'm in the neighborhood I'm going to go eat there. 

They still claim to be using Niman ranch which is false they are using a pre pattied 4oz from restaurant depot With barely any flavor. They don't season the meat at all. 

They're wings are high priced like most places nowadays so I figured those might be good, but no it's bbq sauce on chicken bones no meat like why would you even offer these I'd be embarrassed to sell them. 

I understand food cost and rent goes up and some business owners in SF are scared to raise prices so instead they offer cheaper quality, that is not the route you want to take and that seems the route this place is taking. The prices haven't changed but the quality has, remember people in SF make and have money. They are not scared to spend an extra couple bucks to get good quality food.
author: jay f.

description: Everyone that gave this spot a bad review are trippin'! Sorry if your experience here was mediocre, you must live a pretty meadiocre lifestyle to not like Double Decker & all the amenities they have to offer. All their food here is good, even though I may be craving a burger, I can never come here without ordering some wings with extra sauce. ALSO, it's super crucial you EAT THERE. if you order food to go, you messed up. The staff at DD are super accommodating! If their wings are significantly smaller that day, they give you more wings to make up for it. & their happy hour is the JAM* Me & my folks have been coming here for years (my boyfriend has been a loyal customer for 10+) & pretty much have been putting the owners kids through college through supporting this mom-&-pop establishment. We support local businesses out here, not famous! So maybe if you're a food snob with a princess stomach, Double Decker may not be for you-- Y'all can stick with the food chains, & I'll keep spending my money here*
author: Celine L.

description:
I really appreciate this place. I think it's family-owned, which is getting rarer and rarer nowadays in Hayes Valley....their wings are top-notch, they're always really friendly and excited to help. I haven't had the burgers, just wings and fries, but I love it. Their takeout is lightning fast, too. I'm waiting for my order now and I think it took 6 minutes from order to bagging. So awesome.

The layout and unique building is also a big draw for me; I get such a kick out of it :)
author: Allie D.

description:
Good burgers.  

Really, we used to come here for the chips.  Message me if you decide to bring them back and we'll start eating there again.
author: Dong T.

description: Burger's good. Juicy and flavorful. But i made a mistake of getting the cobb salad($8.50). it was small, cheese was chopped up sliced cheese, and avacado was partly brown. cobb salad usually comes with bacon and blue cheese but not here.
author: K C.

description:
Double Decker is one of those oddly placed restaurants whose background you would like to know. It's nestled in the parking lot of a Days Inn in the well known and trendy neighborhood of Hayes Valley. This hole in the wall spot stands out from its neighbors but it won me over with their superb wings and crisp fries. I have only had the wings drenched in the "Hot" flavor, but it's been so good that I have not tried out the other flavors. The wings come with your classic accoutrements of celery and ranch. The sauce comes with just the right amount of heat and vinegary flavor and since the restaurant does not skimp on the sauce there is a nice amount leftover to dip for the crispy fries.  

The menu also consists of burgers and salads but the other menu options were disappointments. The burger consisted of a thin, unseasoned patty and a flimsy tomato. The salad felt like an afterthought. It's clear that the stars of this restaurant are the wings and nothing else. The shop does wings well and should rally behind this single item, leaving the other disappointing options behind. 

At the end of the day all I have left to write is "Yay! I'm a fan."
author: David M.

description:
Double decker has THE BEST BURGER I have ever had!!! Me and my bf cycle In-N-Out, The Habit, and 5 Guys and this burger is by far our favorite! Every time we come here the burger patty is steaming hot like VISIBLY STEAMING they bring it to you straight off the grill. Happy hour is pretty sweet too! We live in Orange County and go out of our way to eat here when we visit. No doubts about this place. 

The boyfriend: DUDES! Get here now!

I got a Yelp account just so I can rave about this place they deserve it.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I ordered a double decker, chicken burger, original burger, french fries and garlic fries. Everything was on point however the patties could've used a bit more seasoning and the garlic fries could've used a more even distributed amount of garlic.
author: Brenda M.

description: 'Twas okay, but I was really expecting more wings out of the half wings/half fries combo. :'(
author: Shendi X.

description:
Great burgers and amazing shakes!

I was staying at the Days Inn that shares a parking lot so I picked this place because it was super close.  I was alone with my three kids, preschooler and younger so they were in my enormous stroller which took up about half of the downstairs seating area. There is a bench outside but it was occupied so before I had a chance to wonder where I was going to squish my kids in so we could eat, the guy behind the counter started moving the tables and making space. He assured me that there was a upstairs seating so I didn't have to worry about taking up all of his space.

The food was amazing, I thought it seemed pricey but I didn't expect it to be so good. They use local, hormone-free meat and the shakes were fresh enough that I got a few chunks of berry in mine.  The guy behind the counter also asked if I wanted to divide the two shakes I ordered amount my three kids and made sure to slice the burger I got for the older two to share for them.  He also stocked me up on napkins and condiments for the to-go bag since so mentioned that we were staying in the motel.  No complaints from me or my little ones at all.
author: Katie K.

description: Now... They don't look like a spot that would whip up a mean burger, but they most certainly are. We ordered the California burger and garlic fries. The garlic fries as a small are a pretty big basket. The burger is decent size but JUICY & fresh. Whatever you're doing..... Keep it up!
author: Jess T.

description:
Happy hour: cheap wings, cheap fries, cheap beer and wine. I mean rrly. What more do you need?!

We're hungry and wandering the streets one afternoon and stumbled across this place saying to ourselves "oh yeah! The ol' Days Inn Burger Joint! Let's give it a go!"

So we did! The owner was there training a new girl who was a little unsure of herself and shy, but a sweetheart nonetheless. No one else was there. We went upstairs, to the upper deck you might say, and had the place to ourselves. The owner brought our food up and accidentally brought an extra order of fries we didn't order, but he gave them to us anyway and ran back down to, totally unnecessarily, refund us our $2.and some change. 

Great little place to stop into when you're looking for that spot to be hit.
author: Carol M.

description: Been wanting to try this place for about a year. Finally got around to it. Burgers are made to order and delicious. I got mine with grilled onions as opposed to the raw ones.  We had 4 burgers total, double decker, 2 cheese burger, buffalo burger.  All were satisfied with one suggestion...get the hottest sauce for buffalo burger if you want it spicy and ask for extra sauce it got dry at the end. We also got the sweet potato fries, garlic fries and original fries. Not skimpy on the garlic. I like my fries a little crispier but everyone else enjoyed them. We also got an order of wings. Super saucy. Again was expecting more spice, so order hotter than you usually do. Wings were also a bit on the smaller side, but no complaints. (I'd rather have better quality wings than gigantic gmo wings any day).  I'm definitely coming back.
author: Kelly D.

description:
My husband chose this place since he heard the burgers were good and they offered a variety of salads for me. Upon parking I immediately identified this place as a dive...it's located on the corner of a motel I certainly have never noticed in the heart of Hayes valley.

Against my very instincts, I ordered the small cobb salad, and since the building is round and all the seating faces the kitchen, I could see the "chef" making my salad. On what looked like a 5x8" cutting surface (the prepping area was completely cluttered)  he chopped up fake cheese, spotty brown avocado, and two huge hard boiled eggs, placed them on top of some lettuce and topped it with a store bought salad dressing. Might I add, the kitchen was repugnantly dirty and unkept. I mean - the fake terra cotta floors were black. 

I was presented with the most unappetizing array of a meal. Needless to say, I could not bring myself to eat it. Who knows, perhaps there is a possibility the salad would have tasted amazingly insane....but from the LOOK of things it was improbable.
author: Claudia A.

description: After some fri late afternoon drinking this was the only place we could find for a quick and hearty meal. I ordered the original burger and an order of sweet potato fries. The burger was decent; fries were pretty good. Tried my friends onion rings and they were on point!!! It's a small restaurant with a few small tables inside and a picnic table or two outside. Decent burger but don't expect anything gourmet. The burger was only cooked one way (overcooked imo but at least guaranteed safe) and patty was thin but hit the spot!
author: Yin H.

description:
No frills. Just burgers.

My friend and I were looking for a place that looked a) kid-friendly for her baby child and b) was cheap and filling. Double Decker was the closest thing to us because we were not about to spend $27 on fried chicken.

So...the place looked bigger in the pictures. PEOPLE, can we please take photos that accurately describe the atmosphere?! Y'all with your fancy schmancy shots making it look like this place had more seating than it actually did...why?!

Anyway. Yes, it's small, yes, it's attached to a Days Inn, so yes, I would've been skeptical, but you just can't go wrong with a burger that is simply a burger. Also, in the Asian-restaurant style I grew up with, EVERYTHING is all over the place and I think I must've been in the area where EVERYTHING goes. I grew up with this. You probably did not. I was used to it. You may not be. Probably something to keep in mind if ambience is more important to you than delicious burgers.

Buddy got the western, which I totally wanted but I hate ordering the same thing, so I picked up a turkey buffalo burger (buffalo in that it's like buffalo wings, not like it's a buffalo or a turkey that thinks it's a buffalo or vice versa), because I was trying to be healthy. But yeah, I was at a burger place, and that wasn't gonna happen, so I ordered garlic fries because I'm a damn adult.

We sat down at the few tables on the ground floor. Kinda grimy, but it looks like that kind of place, so whatever. Food came pretty quickly and was astoundingly delicious. Funny how you look at an unassuming place and think the food isn't gonna be good. That's your damn mind playing with you. What I learned is that I need more buffalo turkey burgers in my life. It's easier to eat than a buffalo chicken sandwich and extra delicious, despite being really messy. It's okay, though. The garlic fries saved all the things I spilled, which made them even more delicious.

Here's the important thing, though. The little baby child is kind of close to being in his terrible twos. The tables are not exactly stable. So the kid pushes the table and the drinks fly off and it's a mess. Oh man, did we feel bad! But the guy was so nice about it. Straight up graciousness right there. He understood and remembered when his kids were that age, he told us as he cleaned our mess. He even gave us fresh drinks. I tried to pay for the drinks that we didn't buy afterward and he wouldn't hear of it. I have never been so pissed at myself for not having cash, because I wanted to tip this guy and his awesome service.

I'll be back mainly because that guy was awesome and burgers are where it's at.
author: Robbin A.

description:
I stopped by when walking back to my hotel from Alamo Square.

I had a California burger and fries, which was delicious. Service was prompt and though the place was tiny, I found a spot to eat.
author: Rose L.

description:
After reading that Double Decker's burger was on Thrillist's "best under the radar" burgers in SF, a few friends and I decided to give it a try. We came by last Friday afternoon during happy hour, and the place (small as it is) was decently busy.

The service, I will say, was excellent. My friend dropped her bottle of Corona and they brought her a new one. And of all the food, the onion rings were the best. My double-decker burger was fine, but nothing special. My friends' classic burgers were the same. The garlic fries were barely garlicky and the sweet potato fries, like the garlic fries, got soggy very fast. 

It's such an unassuming place, located attached to the Days Inn, but I really thought it might be our new go-to, "secret" spot. In a pinch, I'd go back (I'd love to try the Hawaiian burger), but there are so many great burger places in SF that - given a choice - I'd check out many others first.
author: David B.

description:
I ordered like 6 burgers through DoorDash.

1.I ordered my Original burger well done and I got medium rare. I can't eat this I threw it away.
2.My co-worker ordered the California Burger medium rare, she got really rare..she ended up throwing it away.
3.My boss ordered Onion Rings, she received FOUR onion rings, I shit you not..FOREAL!!!!

Too bad I couldn't refund b/c it was through DoorDash, not a even a SORRY.

I will not be ordering from here again.
author: D M.

description: This little restaurant is just down the street from my house. They have delicious burgers! So glad to have a great burger place so close to me
author: Hemali M.

description: Did not expect much, this burger place was attached me to my hotel. The burger was on par with in and out, not worth the 10$.
author: Kevin R.

description: Delicious hamburgers- we had a Cali burger and their special burger, both delicious and tasty. Their fries were tasty too - their large fries can easily feed two adults.
author: Martha M.

description:
This is one of the best place to get a good classic burger. 
After eat here I recommend you to walk around and get some ice cream on smitten. 

#fast
#pick-up
author: Vicky D.

description:
If you don't know the area like I do, finding this tiny burger joint in Hayes Valley can be a bit of a challenge. Hence, the similar occurrence happens to me when I try to find the popular Blue Bottle Coffee shop when I first joined Yelp in an alley not far in the same area. 

The tiny burger joint is located right below the Days Inn lodge on Grove Street. "Weird location!"

With the name of Double Decker, I ordered the "Double Decker" burger. For $8.50, I get a pair of Medium rare patties, American cheese and the usual condiment in a seeded bun. Every item is sold separately. So I ordered a small basket of Onion Rings for $2.50 and an iced cold bottle of Fat Tire for $4.00. The simple burger is good and not overly greasy. And the burger prices are fair, despite being located in an area known to have a few competitions in the area. The side of onion rings was okay and nothing too exciting. 

The Chinese dudes operating the tiny burger joint were cool and treated me well. 

The joint also serve Buffalo wings too. I may try them as a Happy hour special on my next visit.
author: Matt G.

description: Dry bun and the double decker tasted nothing but garlic. Couldn't even finish it... Good tasty fries and really friendly staff deserves to be mentioned though.
author: Robin B.

description: The real deal. Simple and straight forward. Don't miss the onion rings and garden burger.
author: A B.

description: Decent burgers and there's an upstairs seating area that is nice and cozy for when you're hanging out with a few friends.
author: Yad L.

description:
Had the pineapple teriyaki burger (don't remember the actual name) 

This burger had me speechless from beginning to end. Great taste and none of the ingredients fell out like other burgers I've had. Can't wait to come here again. 

Sweet potato fries were great too
author: Mario D.

description: Cool little burger joint. I got a buffalo burger and garlic fries and they both were great. Little pricey  but other than that no complaints
author: Geoff F.

description:
I heard this is the best place for wings in SF around downtown, and I'd attest to that!

This burgers, wings, and salad joint does Americana right. The meal was not greasy! A great stop for lunch because it's hidden in the middle of the block, has upstairs seating, and never has a line. The wings with mild sauce were delish and the onion rings were gigantic and somehow felt nutrious... odd. Dine in or take it to go!
author: Regina D.

description:
I usually enjoy this place- as the veggie burgers are good, but business is NOT very customer friendly. It took me 1 hour and 40 minutes (order promised within 45-60 minutes) to receive my order and the restaurant did not bother to call me to let me know it was going to be EXTREMELY late. I understand that things happen and sometimes restaurants run late, but very unprofessional and rude to not at least let the customer know the order will show up 40 minutes after the delivery window. No apology- Food was cold. I ordered via Eat24 and they tried to authorize a discount/credit of some kind for the poor customer service/delivery. They simply stated they don't give discounts for late deliveries. 

Seems to me that they don't care about customer courtesy... or customer retention for that matter.
author: Mae D.

description:
The western burger is my favorite! No frills burger joint.  Really hits the spot for lunch.

The buffalo wings are decent. They are crispy, but eat 'em while they're hot. they get soggy real quick!
author: Ls C.

description: Extremely Bad experience and customer service... i would not recommend this place to anyone.  When we wanted to return everything they refuse to do so and told us that we were "screwed". Never again!
author: Sylvia Q.

description: This place should really be $$. A western burger was $9.  When a burger cost $10+ after tip, you shouldn't be able to list it as $. The burger was decent but not $10 decent.
author: Richard T.

description: They make a great tasting burger with spicy buffalo sauce.  Their onion rings are nicely battered, deep fried, and crispy.  It's my go to burger joint in Hayes Valley.  I would say the only improvement needed is their customer service.  Definitely worth a shot!
author: Josh S.

description:
So super small when I first walked in thought, "oh hell na!"

There are only five tiny one person tables (or two skinny girls) and I guess you can go up stairs too but god that'd take so much effort!

They have a few beers on tap and another half dozen in bottles.

Get their name sake, Double Decker and don't look back because it's big, juicy and good. The fries are Sysco or something similar so not worth spending your time on.

Extra 1/2 star for not encountering a hipster and the steady stream of low rent tourist.

I'll be back.
author: Justin S.

description:
One of my top wing spots in San Francisco.

The inferno wings are my canonical buffalo wings. They have the exact sauce I crave when I'm craving buffalo wings. They're hot, crispy, and delicious. And I've eaten a LOT of wings in MANY different places. If you're looking for something beyond the standard Frank's+Butter, don't bother - it's just a classic that shouldn't be messed with.

The delivery hampers the crispiness, and occasionally items get forgotten, but I've learned to just go in person and devour all of the wings. They'll be perfect.
author: Harley C.

description: We placed an office order through Eat24. The food was delivered promptly, but my sandwich was so burnt it was not edible. I called the restaurant to see if they could remake the sandwich and was told that they toast the buns the same way. The guy couldn't believe my sandwich was burnt. He finally said that I'm not their customer that I'm eat24's customer so go through them to get a refund for the sandwich. Thanks for the great customer service, last time any of our office orders from you.
author: Karla M.

description:
Stopped by this joint after an afternoon at Pride! Friend recommended this place and I'm very glad she did. I decided to get the California Burger with regular French Fries. French Fries had this super crunchy outside but a soft inside. I liked them but I didn't love them. 

However I LOVED my burger. Cow pattie was REALLY JUICY! Not a thick slab of meat but I like it that way. My only gripe would be to make the bun a little thicker? Also, my friend got the California Burger as well but it didn't come with avocado...which was supposed to be part of the burger. 

I would say it's pricey for a burger joint ($14 for Burger + Fries + Bottle of Water) but it was really good and I want to come back to try their Western Burger.
author: Cindy B.

description: Consistently fresh tasty and fast.  had their fish & chips today for the first time.  didn't even know they had on the menu.  really hit the spot.  not a gourmet place by any stretched, but the simplicity of the menu, portions, flavor, and staff.  make this walk-up burger joint a major hit with me.
author: Joe M.

description:
Not the best place to get burgers in the neighborhood but certainly the cheapest & quickest if you simply want to get a burger of decent quality, without paying $10 like everywhere else in Hayes. There's not a lot of quick bite, less than $10 dining options when you're living in Hayes.

They do however use Niman Ranch patties in their burgers, which are probably the freshest items on their menu & only thing I'd recommend wholeheartedly. I've stuck around watching them load boxes of frozen food into the kitchen to know everything else is frozen, which explains why even the fresh garlic used with the fries can't hide the frozen fry taste. Then again, almost everything here is fried since the other half of the menu is finger foods or chicken wings.

Wings are a good deal & they do offer some beer on tap which is even better when you swing by during happy hour. So don't expect gourmet, it's really a quick grab and go place fulfilling a certain niche.
author: Steven C.

description: No frills hamburger join. It has maybe 3-4 tables and a counter to order at. I got the Western Burger which has bacon, BBQ sauce and cheddar cheese, and it was, a tasty burger. I will go back again because I often just want a no hassle hamburger for pickup. The onion rings were good but even though I got the small size I feel the portion was a little stingy.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Talk a about a fan freakin tastick burger! We were in San Francisco over the weekend. While we checked into The Days Inn that shares this property on Feb 20, 2015. Earlier in the day when we first arrived on property, I noticed that something smelled really great in the air. I followed my nose to the restaurant. One of the staff was quick to take my order. I told him I was just looking at the menu. He gave me one to take back to our room and told me they were open until 9:00 every night.  

After a busy day of hitting the tourist hot spots we were kind of done and wanted to get back to the room and relax. My family and I decided very quickly to head to the restaurant for a quick meal. Let me just say, it was well worth it. 

I wish I knew about the different types of fries, but I don't fault the staff, my brother placed the order while I was grabbing my sweatshirt. 

The guys working that shift were very professional and among the best I have ever come across in a non branded restaurant with such great employees. 

In short, if you live in this area you probably already know about this gem. If you are new to the area or staying at the Days Inn, do yourself a huge favor and check this place out. Great food, awesome fresh ingredients. 

I hope to hit this place one more time before departure back to Phoenix. 

Now, if they just had t-shirts to buy to help promote this restaurant...
author: Randy N.

description:
Me and my husband have been coming here for almost 5 years now and We have never never left unsatisfied . we love their buffalo wings ( which are the best in sf btw ) and beer and for my beer drinkers out there you have to have to try the holy craft ! You won't regret it . But most of all we love the staff ! 
Jon is the best and he has the coolest kids ! They Always makes us feel welcomed . So if your in the mood for some good food I suggest you check this place out . Happy hour starts at 3 !!!
author: Nicc Z.

description:
Long sentence alert:

Niman Ranch burger, Mitchell's ice cream shakes, freshly fried chips, and (if you know to access the upper dining area by taking the Days Inn stairway) it's a pleasant lunch experience in a quiet part of Hayes Valley.
author: Loli L.

description:
It is good burger!! Not as cheap as I expected since people always tell me to go to DD cause it's price-friendly. I guess if you go with a bunch of friend and order during their happy hours, it is not that bad.
With that said, I do like their burgers. So if you are craving some burgers and don't want to go to a restaurant, try DD. Oh! They do have seats and TVs! So it's good for game seasons.
author: Maggie Z.

description: Had the Original Burger - straight forward burger - pretty good greasy diner style. No BS... Tap beer was pretty spendy for the place - Gotta pay that Hayes Valley rent I suppose.
author: M. U.

description: My roommates and I are obsesssssed with Double Decker - Double D, as we call it. California burger - fries - shake. It's our guilty pleasure and our staple. ORDER IT, Y'ALL. It's too good.
author: Lily D.

description: I didn't really enjoy it but I had low expectations going in.  I got a Hawaiian burger, garlic fries and two bottles of anchor steam for around 21 bucks. Just an average burger and some average beers. The garlic fries were below average. Soggy, with a glob of minced garlic right in the middle. Not well dispersed through out the order. Flippers is right around the corner, and is way better, in my opinion.
author: Matt H.

description: Very good Burgers..........however the last time I ordered delivery, everything was luke-warm....ARGH.
author: Troy H.

description:
ME: "Hi, how 'hot' is the inferno wings?"
CASHIER: "Uhhh, the inferno? Errr, I only eat the mild..."
*Cricket Cricket*

After the Uncorked! Wine Festival on Sat, 5.22.10, my friends and I decided to came to Double Decker for an early dinner at 5:45 PM. 

FOOD:
*Bucket of Half Mild and Half Hot Buffalo Wings($29.95 for 50) -I'm a fan of spicy foods and slather sirarcha, chili oil, chili sauce, etc over pretty much and everything and anything w/ the exception of desserts of course. 

It was ok. The "hot" wings at DD were flaming hot and made my mouth burn. Upon finishing one, it felt like I just crammed a handful of flaming hot cheetos down my throat. The sauce was more spice than anything and not very tangy. More butter was needed to add a more savory finish. After eating several "hot" wings, I had to switch to the "mild" wings which had the spice most similar to tabasco sauce. The wings themselves were crisp, however, b/c they were overfried and fairly tiny, the meat was a little on the dry side. See pics:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2qv3jQh4qTwgvYuTMBUrHw?select=g_A2qnqabgsd2JoRrOIr-w
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2qv3jQh4qTwgvYuTMBUrHw?select=EAP3SKIHPS5A8yCCk9r5wg

The blue cheese dressing was super creamy w/ pungent chunks of blue cheese crumbles which helped cool down the spicinss from the wings. The celery was very fresh and crisp.

*California Burger ($6.95): It was ok to good. The Neiman Ranch Patty was thick and tender, but it was a little on the dry side b/c it was overcooked to a well-done. However, the swiss cheese, avocado, and mayo helped solve the dryness issue. The bun was only toasted on one side which made the the staleness of the bread more apparent b/c the crust and center was slightly hard and not fluffy.

*Garlic Fries (Large - $3.45): Meh! Although it was well-seasoned and there was no shortage of minced garlic, the fries were soggy and held onto the oil like a sponge. Because they use fresh potatoes, I think the problem is they're not soaking it in cold water to draw out the starch. 

CC's accepted.

SERVICE:
DD is very causual; you order at the counter and they bring the food to you. The cashier who didn't know how 'hot' the inferno was seemed very aloof. It took about 10 minutes to get out order of wings, burger, and fries.

AMBIANCE/DECOR:
DD is very divey and is an odd U-Shaped. It's attached to the Days Inn next door. There's 3 small tables on the first floor which seats 6 people. The upper level seats about 14 people. There's flat screens on both levels which was on the local sports station. 

PARKING:
Street parking only which can be a little difficult in Hayes Valley. 

I wouldn't make a special trip to DD for their burgers or buffalo wings b/c they weren't very memorable. There's a lot of undiscovered places in the city, so on to the NEXT ONE!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: It was 8:45. They closed at 9. They said we had to get our burgers to go. We'd had drinks at Smugglers Cove earlier so I didn't care where I ate my burger. We ordered two double decker and a large fries. The gentle,an who took our order turned over a table and invited us to sit. When the burgers were cooked I went to grab them but the gentleman would have none of it. He brought them and then the fries with sides of BBQ and ranch. The burger was the best I've had in years. The meat was amazing and the two kinds of cheese were perfect. I can't recommend this place enough and I can't thank double decker enough for their hospitality.
author: David G.

description:
Among the more affordable places in Hayes Valley. No frills, kinda old school burger diner, think truck stop-ish after a long haul.  A little hideaway of the neighborhood if just want to get some good old fashioned eats without the bother of pretense and fluff. 

Happy hour has a couple beer selections: macrobrews, but inexpensive and good enough. 

I tend to have the buffalo chicken burger which is mildly spicy (can ask to turn up the heat though), generous  size of chicken breast and topped with fresh veggies.  The bun is toasted perfectly and adds a yummy crunch. 

There are two floors for seating with all condiments. Only qualm is that the seat benches feel a bit on the sticky side. 

This is a little refuge in Hayes Valley, and I hope to return soon...
author: Vivial S.

description:
Gotta say, after reading allot of bad reviews of this place I feel pretty lucky. I've ordered maybe about 6 or 7 times in the last 3 years. It's always been spot on. Tonight, which I'm still from a high of, came about 15 minutes before the scheduled delivery and was friggin' awesome! Rare burger, crispy veggies, perfectly ripe avocado. 
 Good wings as well. Could have used more blue cheese dressing, but very satisfied. Very happy and now I must pass out..
author: Fabian F.

description: Wings are small but pretty good. The hotness is about one level down from the name. Ordered a bunch for a work lunch and everyone was satisfied. Putting the order in was a little slow, I think the person on the phone was still waking up since I called at 10:30am. They also charged extra for ranch because I asked for 4, but they didn't bother to tell me that all the orders came with ranch naturally, so we just ended up with a ton of ranch.
author: Adamme K.

description: I tried the Double Decker burger after a friend who lived in the neighborhood made the bold claim that this place at the BEST BURGER IN SF. The burger was decent but what killed me was that they used grocery store buns. If they used better bread, the burger would have been much better. Also the toppings like the lettuce and tomato very not very crisp and didn't really stand out to me. Pretty much the only thing that stood out was the meat. At the $10 price point, it was a solid burger but nothing special.
author: Alex P.

description: I was staying at the connected motel, and I saw that the Double Decker was closed for the day, but there was someone still inside, and the door was wide open. I needed to get some apple juice in the morning, and I wanted to know if it was something they stocked, so I said to the woman "I know that you are closed, but I just want to know if you sell apple juice." She responded in a rude, dismissive tone "we are closed." She did not listen to me and she did not answer my question. Terrible customer service. In the morning I did not go back, as I did not want a second serving of rudeness.
author: martin r.

description: Hidden in the parking lot of a motel, it looks a little sketchy, but the burgers are great. Try the Buffalo burger hot with bacon added.  Happy Hour special are decent too.
author: Sam R.

description: I tried this place for the first time last week and really enjoyed it. I ordered the California burger which was huge, juicy, and delicious. I also tried their garlic fries which were super garlicky but not overly salted  - so perfect. I would definitely call them again for delivery.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I work nearby and decided to give this place a try.

I arrived around 12:30 and no customers were there, which I thought was strange. I ordered my Original Burger, paid, and was told to take a seat. There are only a few tables in this small joint, so choosing a seat wasn't too difficult. One of the tables was occupied by, (who I believe), an employee. He was on his laptop.

I was happy to witness that they started grilling my burger after I ordered. (As opposed to having it precooked and only warming up the meat.) There were a few people who came to pick up orders. So if you can, and have your heart on trying this place, my bet it to eat-in or pick-up. I would NOT have it delivered, (only b/c of the bad reviews from others).

I ordered my Original Burger to be w/o mayo or onions, which is exactly what I got. The meat was hot so I had to wait a little for it to cool down. Overall, I believe this is a good burger for its price ($5.95+tax), however I will venture to a few other places before I choose this as a default.
author: Ariel P.

description: Awesome burger joint that we stumbled upon by accident.  It serves Niman Ranch beef burgers, unless you want veggie or chicken.  My California burger was fresh, juicy, and delicious.  Didn't try the fries.  The restaurant space was a bit awkward; not really a sit down and eat type of place, but we did anyway and it was fine.  Definitely worth a visit.
author: Erica H.

description: This is a good, simple burger place. There's nothing fancy about it, even though they are house in a two-story building adjacent to a motel. It's a great place to go to for an honest burger with a sesame bun, lettuce, tomato, pickles, and onion. Feel free to add cheese, bacon, or avodaco. But really, that's it. You're in the wrong place if you're looking for fancy-schmancy gourmet burgers. Both the fries and chips are made in house and taste best when hot. Do not let these sit in a to-go bag! The fries are thick cut. Service is friendly and courteous.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
1. Delivery took over 1.5 hours.
2. They didn't bring the beverages.
3. Buffalo wings were soggy and small (7 on taste)
4. Burger just average

Considering it's tagged with "Burgers, Chicken Wings" I had high hopes.
Bottom line: I regret trying this place and won't be a return customer.
author: Jeremiah W.

description:
WORD OF THE MEAL: DREADFUL

Placed an order here via Eat24. Aside from the poor response from Eat24 (which was a severe disappointment and documented in another review), the delivery time was DOUBLED, the food was FREEZING COLD, and the order was WRONG (i.e. missing one of two burgers). Of the whole burger that finally made the journey from griddle to home, only two-fifths was consumed -  sad for any amount of quality beef. 

=[. that's all. just, =[.
author: Sean A.

description: After not having wings for a while, we went to Double Decker and were extremely happy with the food. The wings here are super meaty and the taste of the sauce was amazing! I would come back every week if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Garnett S.

description:
It speaks a lot when a burger&wings joint does grilled chicken sandwiches well.

I had the California Chicken Sandwich. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2qv3jQh4qTwgvYuTMBUrHw?select=4_5B7kOdzAUORxLfNbvlDA) Grilled chicken breast, topped with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, avocado and swiss cheese. Yummy!! The chicken was juicy but lack a bit of flavor. Problem-solved after a generous mad-dash helping of ground pepper. (I'm a black pepper fiend!) 

Also had their homemade potato chips. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2qv3jQh4qTwgvYuTMBUrHw?select=Le6vQhW7H-EeksOPjCBFUw) Hot and crispy! Yummmm!

All-you-can-eat buffalo wings for $11.95 Wednesdays 4pm-8pm?!?!?!? I'm so there!!! =)
author: Marti L.

description: I ordered delivery and food was delish and delivered in 15-20min.  Would recommend highly
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
The food here is pretty low quality but the prices are also low. 

I've had the wings & fries here 2 times and wasn't impressed either time. I guess it's fine if you just want a quick bite at a low price... 

One thing I can't stand is a soggy wing. There's an art to making a good buffalo wing. It needs to be equal parts crispy & saucy. Unfortunately, Double Decker hasn't mastered the art that is the buffalo wing. Their wings are too soggy & not crispy enough. I don't want to feel like I'm chewing on pre-cooked chicken skin. Gross!

I understand that this place has been around for quite some time so I'm sure they get other items on their menu right but I'm not coming back here. Not for wings at least.
author: Tasha T.

description: Really awesome little spot in Hayes. Came here last night for a western burger, garlic fries and beer and boy, was it good. The staff was friendly, the burger was tasty, and the fries were so crispy and perfect. I split my burger with my friend who got a California burger. We both liked the western burger better but the BBQ sauce was pretty cold and chilled the burger a bit, but still delicious. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 was that it was a little more expensive than what I expected (~15.50 for burger, small garlic fries and a bottle of anchor steam), but I will certainly come back often when the burger crave hits. Those garlic fries were cooked to perfection and maybe the best I've ever had.
author: Sarah B.

description: Love their wings and their prices, this is my go to wing spot when Im looking to get my spicy poultry fix...I recommend getting the inferno yum yum ymu
author: Paige M.

description:
Best wings in SF.  

I moved to the city 4 years ago and have been on the constant lookout for the best wings around ever since.  Double Decker is still the best, taking into consideration the taste, value (wings per $), size, and potency of the sauce.  The inferno is pretty hot, enough that I break a sweat every time.  Try getting an order of the delicious fries with your wings.  They're a good compliment.

This is no gourmet restaurant, nor is it your local dive bar.  It's just a burger joint that make delicious, hot wings. The environment adds to the charm of the experience for me, and I like the guys running it.  

Go to this place if you love wings and hanging out.
author: Sam G.

description: Total hole in the wall but their happy hour (M-F 3-6.. i think) is stellar. $3 beers which includes either from their taps or from the bottles in the fridge which made for a pretty big selection. They have this one local beer on tap (really sad I can't remember the name) but it's like 8% alcohol and tastes great. So that for $3 already makes this place worth it. Also, for happy hour they have $5 wings which were good but nothing too exciting. On the other hand, the garlic fries were great and reminded me of the Gilroy fries from at&t park. We will be back (and back and back and back) for beer and fries!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I had the cheeseburger with fries and it was pretty good. The burger was very tasty, the quality of meat very good! The toppings were fresh, the fries a little overcooked but still good, not too greasy. 

I'm actually looking forward to trying the wings, they looked very good. 

The employees were all friendly and it was a real team effort in fulfilling the orders. Great job!
author: Aisha M.

description:
So so disappointing.  If I'm going to ingest a bunch of grease I want it to at least be good and satisfying.
Fries were grease sops with absolutely no flavor.  All I could taste was grease.  You know the yellowish part of your fries that is crisper where the grease has really soaked in.  At double decker this was the whole fries.
I was going to have a vege burger until I saw the costco bag of cheap vege patties.  I went for the chicken instead.  At least it wasn't greasy but it was entirely flavorless.
Decor didn't help.  Just a bunch of greasy dirty used restaurant items crammed in the little space.
This is the 3rd of iteration of restaurant that I've been to in this spot (I've been going here since it was an Italian place in the early-90's) and this is by far the worst.
author: Ric S.

description: Ordered delivery from here. The burger tasted good enough but arrived very soggy. The French fries, onion rings tasted ok, but definitedly not hoome made. The potato salad tasted like the stuff that comes in large plastic containers from Costco. Likely won't order from here again. Oh well...
author: JS K.

description: Went here for lunch today with a coworker. The burger and fries were excellent. We sat upstairs at the top deck of the restaurant. Reasonably priced. I will return again.
author: Kiana D.

description:
Allo Guv'nor!

Now wouldn't it make sense if they painted the building red to make it look like a real Double Decker bus? They could paint headlights and little signs that say "Leicester Square" or "Tower of London". Oh and they could get a bunch of those movable trolls from the "It's a Small World" ride in Disneyland, the ones dressed like royal guards that do high kicks in unison, and put them outside the windows. Yeah I like that...and then they could paint George Michael propositioning a cop at a urinal. Oh wait, that was in LA, wasn't it?...but hey, they could play "Rule Brittania!" on a loudspeaker. Is it a wonder to you that I'm not on HGTV Design Star?

Like many others, I always thought the compact space adjoining the Days Inn was a bit eccentric to put in any eatery beyond a motel coffee shop. Previously, it was the pricier Zoya, and I think it was a sushi place before that. Now it's Double Decker Burgers, which seems like a more appropriate match since it is two floors and kinda shaped like a burger. It's just too bad that it's on Grove away from the heart of Hayes Valley since it's the type of place that would probably attract spontaneous foot traffic.

I had their signature $7.95 Double Decker Burger, and it was quite good if a bit sloppy (see my photo). They use Niman Ranch beef, but nowadays, who doesn't?...and they melt both American and Swiss cheese on it. Its most direct comparison point is Pearl's, and it even comes in the same red baskets. They have chicken and veggie options as well, and buffalo wings is their other specialty. French fries come separately, and you can get a small basket for $3 - good homemade variety and not too oily (see my photo). There are five small tables on the ground floor and more seating upstairs where you get a panoramic view of...uh, the Grove and Gough intersection. Yeah, how pretty...uh-huh.

FOOD - 4 stars...good burger and a better deal than Flipper's if you want a straight-up burger without the toppings
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...a squeeze in there
SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly in there though it seems a mite overstaffed even on a Pride Saturday
TOTAL - 4 stars... give it a try...I'd like to see this one succeed
author: Ed U.

description: Very good little burger joint. I had the Original Burger and a small side of fries. Meat was excellent and perfectly cooked. All ingredients were fresh. Bun was really good. Fries were fresh, and again perfectly cooked. Portions were generous. Quite happy with the experience.
author: John N.

description:
Burgers were alright, huge though! Ordered the extremely spicy one, and boy were they not kidding, flaming HOT. Ordered a side of onion rings and fries, fries were okay but the onion rings didn't seem so fresh. 
The seating upstairs was quite unexpected..nice view and quiet when there's not much people around.
I think I'll stop by when in the neighborhood but wouldn't go out of my way to go.
author: Windy L.

description:
Just finishing a meal from here :] lol.

the Burger: 4/5 it was really good, especially a good hangover cure, lol.
I added mushrooms on mine, and I asked for avocado, but they didn't add it ;(
but, it was still good.. it was kind of small, it fit right in the palm of my hand, and my hands are a little small for a 22 year old... Hm.
 
the fries: 4/5, they were nice and crunchy, soft fries. my son loved them of course, what 2 year old doesn't love fries? haha, well.. yeah. they were good. only little part that I didn't like was, they were a little greassy.. every few fries I bit into, felt like grease squirted into my mouth... yuck.. only thing I didn't like much about them..

I also got Macaroni salad, not the BEST I've had, but it is your average macaroni salad, a nice side dish with the burger, I'll give a 3/5..

Cesar salad, was good 5/5. basic everyday cesar salad, with crutons and dressing. can't go wrong there... =]

and that was all. my total was around $22..

I ordered online, the time the placed the order was at around 1pm. and food didn't come till almost 2.. so, I had to wait for my food =/ but I guess the burger was worth the wait, and I think I will be ordering again from here next time I crave a burger :]

and a coke soda to wash this all down. haha.

Yum Yum !



edit: 10/20/13 -- ordered online, at 1:35, food didn't deliver up until 3:20pm..
and food was a bit cold. they should have a better system for when they have their busy days :/ 

but, the food was still good.
author: Mariana O.

description: Great burger. You can tell it's not the performed patties, but instead a fresh packed Niman Ranch burger. Garlic fries were on point as well. Will come back when I want a good burger and want to avoid the pomp associated with the rest of Hayes.
author: Mr. X.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for around 6 years and been going here almost the entire time. I'm writing a review because they have recently updated some of their ingredients / components and I thought it was worth mentioning. 

Here's why i'm going with 5 on this and many of these reasons may not apply to your experience:

- They're fast. I can get in and out in 10 minutes even without calling ahead. Full disclosure: I eat veggie burgers which may cook faster or something

- Speaking of, they've changed their veggie burger patties and they're waaaay better

- New buns that are far softer and seem fresher. Almost doughy but in a good way. Really good

- Fries are on the greasy side but are crisp and consistent. Very few softies.

- Lettuce is portioned and balanced. No hard white parts and doesn't overwhelm the burger.

*** The "Inferno" sauce is no joke, wannabe tough guys get it to look cool and have a shitty time (I have done this myself). In my opinion, the "hot" is right on target.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Would rare as 2.5 if I could. I ordered the original burger with cheese, fries and a chocolate shake. My BF ordered the buffalo burger (I think that's what it was called) and onion rings. 

My burger was OK. Edible but nothing exciting. BF's burger was cold. He requested medium rare and it was delivered very rare. His onion rings were clearly frozen onion rings and not very good. 

On the is side:  my fries were pretty good. The chocolate shake was the best thing we ordered.

Can't comment on location since our food was delivered. Delivery took about an hour, give or take 5 minutes. 

Will not be ordering again from Double Decker.
author: Cindi C.

description:
Place is a bit of a dump but has potential to be cleaned up.  It's a small octagon shaped shack at the foot of a Days Inn Hotel in Hayes Valley that I've probably went by a hundred times since I live nearby.
The Niman Ranch Classic cheese burger is what I ordered since it was the most basic and that;s how I roll on a first visit to any burger joint.  It did not disappoint.  Beef was good and cooked perfectly..    I always say a good burger does not require catsup or mustard if it was done right and that was the case here.  A littler pepper and I was good to go.  The fries were pretty good too.  (Those I had swimming in catsup tho ;)
The service a bit slow..........  12  minutes I thought was a bit long for a burger but i was delivered to my table and presented well.  If they would just clean up the place a little and work on their expediency I'd give it another star.  I these things aren't so important to you, by all means try it.
Oh, and I haven't tried it yet but they supposedly popular for their wings too.
There apparently have an online order and delivery system too.
author: John W.

description:
My name is Abby and I'm a cheeseburger addict. 

'Tis true. When in times of crisis, some people turn to alcohol, while others prefer women or gambling. My vice is a thin patty between two sesame seed buns. I'm not proud of it, but it's something I've come to terms with.

After a day of boozin' it up and singing karaoke (badly, I might add), nothing makes me happier than a cheeseburger with a side of crinkle fries. The burgers at Double Decker are on the thin side, so if you're a fan of big chunks of rare meat, this isn't the spot for you. BUT if you like the small, crispy kind, this is your place!

Now that I've read all the reviews about the hot wings, I wish we'd tried these too. But when I'm on a burger bender, nothing is going to get in my way. I also love the fact that they offer beer on-tap, so if you haven't had enough to drink that day/evening, you can always throw back a few while you wait for the food to be cooked. 

I'm happy to add Double Decker to my Yelp Cheeseburger list! Can't wait to go back the next time in town!
author: Abby S.

description:
Stopped in today for a burger and it's the best I've had in SF. Far superior to the nearby Chez Maman West and Absinthe (which, to be fair, are not burger joints). If you are in/around Hayes Valley and craving a burger then look no further. The decor is, well, nonexistent, it's a tiny spot attached to a Days Inn. That said, it was totally clean and had plenty of seating, including an additional upstairs level just for dining.

The burger delivers a juicy and tender interior with a delectable crisp on the outside. I think the secret here is in the sourcing - the ground beef all comes from Niman Ranch, which is an Alameda based collective of livestock producers who raise and process animals ethically and responsibly. Whole wheat buns with fresh lettuce/tomatoes/pickle are rounded out by perfectly melted cheese (in my case both Swiss and Cheddar on the "Double Decker" burger).

Well worth a visit for any burger connoisseur, you will not be disappointed. There is beer and wine as well, and a nice little happy hour, although again, don't go for the ambiance, this place is more concerned with making great food quick and easy than having a nice looking place.

As such, it's definitely not a date spot; nor vegetarian friendly (a few salad offerings that don't seem to be the strong suit of the place). This is a great spot for inexpensive, yet high quality food of the burger/wings/fries variety.

Enjoy!
author: Sam P.

description: This place is a little hidden gem. from the outside you would never know they have awesome wings and food. it is connected to a small hotel and it looks like a hole in the wall. It is pretty tiny but they have used the space well. you can order your food downstairs and they have some small tables. But upstairs there is a small room with more tables and a tv to enjoy some beers. There is a tree right outside the building that looms over the windows so it feels as if you are in a tree house. Besides being a small spot the wings are delicious and the service it quick. They have different flavor wings and they were all pretty good. the classic wings were on point. they also have some good happy hour deals. This place is probably great for delivery because of the small amount of seats but if you can grab one definitely enjoy hot crispy wings!
author: Nia R.

description:
Ordered office lunch / many buckets o wings to arrive by 1230.     When it wasn't here at 1250 I called and they were like, ahh, this says delivery by 330....ummmm....ahhhh...oh, maybe it was 1230.    We can have them there in an hour in a half...does that work.  

No gentleman that doesn't work.   EPIC FAIL.   Crossed off the lunch list.
author: Susan C.

description:
So I went to the ALL YOU CAN EAT WINGS on Wednesday (4pm-8pm) for
$13.95 per person. 

Each portion is around like 20 wings, boy was I full. Good thing my friend was able to take down 2 baskets worth by himself, so that we got our $'s worth. 

Garlic fries are the bomb here, but unfortunately can't say the same about my breath.

The seating is horrrrible! Greasy tables, sticky floors, and dirty tables & windows.  (hence the -1 star).
author: Karen P.

description:
Delivery took an hour and a half. Everything was cold.
I asked for no onions and no tomatoes - my burger came with both.
I paid for a side of Ranch for my fries - it wasn't Ranch, it was melted white plastic in a tub.

I won't order from here again.
author: Pamela W.

description:
1.  Easy to order on http://eat24hours.com/

2.  Delivery - Order placed at 3:57 PM.  Delivered at 4:22 PM.  25 minutes is a very fast delivery.  The delivery person was very polite and professional.  There is no delivery charge.

3.  Delivery Minimum - Relatively high ($20)

4.  Double Decker Burger - I really wanted to like it. It looked great.  It was cooked beyond the requested medium.  However, that was not the most significant issue.  I just did not like the taste of the meat.  I am not sure if it was a season mix or something.  The bun was a nice bun.  The condiments were fresh.  It was a good sized burger.

http://tinyurl.com/3awzwq5

5.  Fries - These were just basic fries.  I am sure they would be better at the restaurant but I still do not think they would be anything to write home about.

6.  Chocolate Shake - This was the highlight of the meal.  It was a great shake.  I really enjoyed it.

7.  Prices - Their prices seem pretty good.  It is not cheap but they are pretty much in-line with most burger places.

Canned Soda 2 $1.25
Milkshakes 1 $5.75
French Fries (Large) 1 $2.95
Double Decker Burger 1 $8.45
Subtotal: $19.65
Total:   $21.52 

8.  Overall, everything was good except I didn't like the taste of the burger.  Unfortunately, that pretty much trumps everything else.  But tht is my personal taste.  You might really like the flavor.
author: Mark D.

description:
This is definitely a place to go only for the food.  There ain't much else there.  Just a few tables on both levels, with barely enough room to turn around.  If that doesn't matter to you, then read on.

They serve both burgers and chicken wings, and my family had both.  It was a Wednesday, so I had the all-you-can-eat wings.  My wife and daughter had a burger.  I got my money's worth out of the wings (they lost money on me!), they were nice and spicy.  Hot was pretty hot, so I think Inferno could light a match if you breathe on it.  The burgers were cooked quite rare.  My wife liked her Original Burger, but she's had better.  My girl didn't finish hers, so I did, and I thought it could have been better.  (Maybe if she didn't dump salt on it, I'd think higher of it :-).)

Not quite a Destination, those places are a block away on Hayes, but it looks like the kind of place where people who live within five blocks could come to hang out and watch the game while having an okay burger and great wings.
author: Ron L.

description:
Tonight was our first time. After reading the reviews I knew I wanted to try it. 

Cons:

Long wait for food
Small eating area downstairs
Had one frozen fry on top of my greasy fries

Pros:

Wings=Amazing
Double Decker burger=delicious 
Fries=yummy, but very greasy

The food was very delicious. The patty in the burger was very tasty and the wings(hot) spicyness was the perfect amount of heat. 

Conclusion:

If you're thinking about trying this place out, Just do it!
author: Arnel S.

description: Very good - CA Burger delicious! Sweet Potato Fries yummy! Shakes Rich and Creamy! We had them deliver which was so fast and friendly person! We will diffidently call and get food from Double Decker again!
author: Andrrs B.

description:
Delivery is a precious thing. 

Not enough places do it. And not enough places do it well.

But Double Decker - delivers all around, when it comes to quality fast finger food - at your door - thanks to their...

1.) Delivery skills.

For orders over 15 dollars they deliver for free (though make sure they deliver to your area - before placing a call - and make sure to give them advance notice for bigger orders.)

2.) Their burgers and shakes. 

Their burgers are made with Niman Ranch Prime Beef from family-owned farms and their creamy shakes are made from Mitchell's ice cream. Very San Francisco.

3.) Their buffalo wings. 

They serve buffalo wings, soaked in homemade buffalo sauce. There's nothing quite like a quality spicy plate of fresh buffalo wings. If you like things hot -  I recommend the inferno.

4.) Buffalo wings to the power of 3. 

Wednesdays from 4pm - 8pm - for just $13.95 per person - it's all you can eat wings night. Read number 3 again  - and jump right back down to 4 and take a deep breath. 

Then get those fingers dialing. 

Double Decker - it's what's up.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: As far as low key neighborhood burger places go, this place is excellent. Yeah they don't use homemade buns, but you can get a fancy burger around the corner at Monsieur Benjamin. The burgers taste great, the happy hour specials are really good, and the place just feels like a hole in the wall. There are too few places like this still standing in Hayes Valley.
author: greg s.

description: Service could have been friendlier which is why I can't give these guys 5 stars.  The food, however, was memorable.  Great quality burger patties with fresh toppings.  Tasty fries.  This place is a complete dive but worthy of another visit when the mood strikes for a reasonably priced tasty burger.
author: A H.

description:
My company ordered some wings (100) from here today. Double Decker delivered them to the office hot.

These were the best wings I've ever had. Flavorful, cooked to perfection, and the skin was just right (not rubbery at all).

The price was right ($36 for 50 wings) and lower than most other places that serve wings in SF. I'm very surprised that for the lower price we got such quality.

My only complaint is that they gave us a few cups of bleu cheese. They gave us ranch, too, but still, dont even put bleu in front of me!
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
This review is for an order placed through seamless for delivery. I placed my order at 7:17PM, did not get my confirmation until 8PM and did not hear from Double Decker until I called to check the status of my order, at which point they told me deliver would be another hour and a half. It's disrespectful to not communicate the fact that delivering a meal is going to take more than 2 hours and 15 minutes and waiting for the customer to call in to update them.

I never had the chance to experience the quality of the food because I was unwilling to wait that long for dinner. I hope they're more respectful of other people's time in the future.
author: Vikram H.

description:
Stopped by with a friend for burgers, onions rings, fries (sweet potato and regular small orders). The food was terrific. The classic burger was cooked perfectly, with a minimal amount of thinly sliced red onion which enhanced the flavor with out overpowering it.  The onions rings were very good. the fries, both kinds were good, not too salty, not at all greasy. I would definitely go back again and try the other burgers and wings.  I would not say the burger was the very best in the city but it was very good. 

I will probably not try the delivery based on other reviews but would definitely stop by for take out again.
author: Janet C.

description: We placed our order online and it arrived on time, actually a few minutes early. All of our food (6 different types of burgers, fries, garlic fries and onion rings) was prepared as ordered and arrived fresh and hot. Thank you Double Decker!
author: Kymberli R.

description:
I give Double Decker 4 stars for being the best burger-to-go in Hayes Valley, hands down. Tasty and filling. I usually order the western burger or the CA burger. Sometimes I order large fries, sometimes small fries. I'm convinced they are the same size. When I get home with my order, I can never really tell. 

They usually have sports games on which seems to draw a regular crowd, but personally, I like to take it to go.
author: Russell Allen E.

description: Food was great live the California burger wish their milkshakes were a bit more bigger i pretty full of my burger and garlic fries could finish the fries
author: Jacqueline V.

description:
Yay! A burger place that does their veggie burgers right! Their fries cost extra, but are worth it if you're just in that kind of self destructive mood. 
The service is always friendly and fast. 
Sometimes the seating can fill up quickly, I was in here during the world series and the upstairs and downstairs where both full of people looking to grub and have a beer while watching the game. 
I live super close, so I just walk here, but they do offer free delivery! If you're staying at the Day's Inn, or you live in Hayes Valley,  and are craving good old fashioned American burgers, go here!!!
author: joanna r.

description: Review for their wings only - I was craving something bad after shopping and decided to stop by for some wings. $5.95 for 6pcs --not outrageous but considering the wings were tiny and extremely greasy...didn't sit well at all. Skip.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Oh geez I've found my wing joint! This place is great. San Francisco sucks when it comes to wings. I live in mission terrace, work at Union Square and volunteer around North Beach and I can't find a place with damn wings. But man oh man this place makes up for that long drought I've had.
Big ol' wings drenched in sauce. No breading which is good for my low carb life. And $10 for 13 of 'em.
Their blue cheese actually tastes like blue cheese too. Not that crappy hidden valley stuff that tastes like, um, not really blue cheese.
If I ever take the wife to the symphony and we are all nice and dressed up, I'm still gonna have a hard time resisting to get some wings 2 blocks away!
author: Ryan E.

description: Best burger in SF! Loved the place small but good and I mean really good food! Their western burger is really good. It's a hidden place but I would recommend it to anybody
author: Morgan D.

description: Good burgers and wings, with a great happy hour. Do not even bother with Flippers, come here instead.
author: Christian S.

description: Burger had too much garlic. Not that I think ground beef should have any garlic. Very disappointing. Was looking forward to good old-fashioned hamburger.
author: Neal D.

description: Amazing burgers! Definitely the best burger in Hayes Valley. I enjoy getting the western burger and then adding onion rings onto it. Their fries are also really delicious! Great value for satisfying, classic food.
author: P. H.

description:
As an upstate New Yorker, whose friend from high school made a documentary film about Buffalo-style chicken wings, I can say, without reservation, that Double Decker has the best wings in San Francisco. 

I don't live in SF any more, but when I did, I came here often and never ordered anything other than the wings. Get them.
author: Brad L.

description:
Best wings ever!!!!! The inferno is on point and their sweet potatoes and garlic fries!
Their burgers are also super yummy. Been coming here for over 10 years. Its the perfect Burger/Wing  joint :) All my friends love this place as well
author: Monica L.

description: If you go, pay cash.  My credit card statement showed an amount 10 more than I was charged.... Yes the burger was good, but I would have gone somewhere that wasn't a hole-in-the wall if I wanted to pay 22 for a burger and fries.
