Such a shame bc I was quite happy with my experience overall until I saw the charges.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Great Buffalo Wings, Cheap and Delicious, I don't know it is fresh or not, i try the burger one time. the lettuce seems very weird, and i don't want to touch it, i bet IN-N OUT burger and better than this.  This place is not good for eat in, they located behind inn, also it's HARD to find parking place in Hayes Valley. But if you only want to eat wings, fries, drink beers, go for!
author: Momo G.

description: Skip the long lines and the expense of Hayes Valley and pop in to Double Decker for a bite! It's your standard grill fare, like burgers, salads, wings, onion rings and fries. There's beers and wine, too! I feel like this would be a great place to bring a small group of friends to watch a game on the tv and just hang during your meal. I really enjoy this cute little (and I really mean little) place and honestly, the burgers are way better here than the other burger place on Hayes St.
author: Nic E.

description:
I dropped by while walking around the neighborhood. Checked Yelp at the door and YOU ALL LET ME DOWN.  This was bad.  Ordered a double burger with bacon and cheese, asked for no onions. You'd think they would mention that they put onions in the meat, right?  At least I hope they do, as something to excuse the horrid taste. It was just a grey mash of something. At least they forgot the bacon so I wouldn't feel bad about throwing that away. They didn't forget to charge for it. $14 for a burger and a beer. 

I tried a few more bites hoping it would somehow get better. No dice. Tossed 80% of the burger and walked to another spot. The family that apparently lives there was nice and a beer was 2.50, so not all bad.  Maybe the next owners will do better.
author: Tom L.

description: awesome wings, really cheap price for a great amount of food and great quality. They also serve HolyCraft beer on Tap which goes perfect with the wings and burgers. took wings out for the giants games and everyone loved them. some friends didnt get enough and tried to get wings from another place, they were highly disappointed. I had bought 150 wings for the world series championship game for 10 people, they were all gone by the 7th stretch.
author: Steve S.

description: I think not. This place was on Wes Burger's list of little know burgers to try in SF. While, he was right on with The Corner Store, he couldn't have been more wrong on Double Decker. The bun, lettuce and tomato were wilted (lack of texture/snap), and the meat had an usual taste. But, most importantly, I got food poisoning. I would not recommend you eat here. Skip it!
author: Jaime R.

description:
Painfully Painfully below-average at best. No, I just lowered it from two stars to one star. Man oh man, how do you make a burgers with so many things in it look so sorry? You use wilted and stale veggies. The meat patty was tiny! there was no flavor at all. I feel like I ate a burger flavored chewing gum.  

My gf and I ordered cheeseburgers, I got a salad with mine and she got onion rings for us to share. There were 4-5 small (cold) onion rings. Not enough to share at all, and wilted. We didn't even finish them. In fact, all of our food was cold. The burger was so sorry looking, I wanted to hold it close to me, give it a hug and tell it its going to be ok.  

Instead I ate it. And I was ashamed of myself for doing so, but... the hunger!!! I have the walk of shame after eating this thing.

I thought they forgot my mushrooms in the burger. 
It wasn't until slightly more careful inspection did I notice them welded underneath the cheese. very very sorry looking. 

The burger was filling, but not fulfilling. It filled my stomach but it depleted my soul. There was nothing "double" about double decker. Custom burger and Burger Meister destroy this place. 

Save yourself and your taste buds, avoid double decker.
author: Anish B.

description: Great place for lunch dinner and  happy hour. There is an upstairs room that is great for groups.
author: Dave S.

description:
Do you like buffalo wings? Like a lot? 

Of course you do. Say hello to Double Decker's All-You-Can-Eat Wings Wednesday!! For $13.99, get a stamp and access to -- wait, the privilege to -- satisfy your most sensational wings cravings for 4 full hours. 

Are you a badass that can enjoy (read, tolerate) the inferno wings? I am. 41 to be exact. Please, no applause necessary. 

Just don't be surprised when your friends have to roll your fat ass home. Then there's the inevitable food coma. And I don't even want to discuss the day after. But that said, it's worth every mouth-searing moment.  

Minus 1 star for not having a leaderboard/legends wall. If you're not first, your last.
author: William H L.

description:
Aptly named, the double decker is round shaped with two floors of seating both of which help it to resemble a burger.

The burger ($5.95) was very tasty. Can't go wrong with Niman ranch beef. But quick note on fixings Double Decker. Ask before you spread because mayo is loathed as much as it is loved. Steak fries ($1.95) were classically delicious. Stayed warm a surprisingly long time.

The happy hour deals are awesome. Monday-Friday 3-6pm offers 3.50 wings, 2.50 draft beer, and 1.50 small sides. I'll totally be back. They take cards which was unexpectedly awesome.
author: Quentin J.

description:
I have eaten their food on 4 separate occasions - the fries are usually soggy, unclear how they are being prepared in the kitchen. Their chips are okay but no better than say "Kettle" chips. 

Every burger I have ever had has had a strange taste to it and when I finally asked I was told there was garlic inside the patty and it wasn't a condiment which could be removed. 

Their wings get smaller every time I order them - if you looking for some with some meat to bit into forget it - you're getting something smaller than your pinkie - its basically sauce, skin, a tiny bit of meat and mostly bone - although I do give them point for serving blue cheese dressing with them.

I've had their chicken burger that also had a strange taste although I could never put my finger on what the taste was. 

I wanted to like this place as it's in my neighborhood and I did go 4 different times trying different things on the menu - the only thing I can actually was good with no reservation was their strawberry shake. 

Save your money and your taste buds and go somewhere else.
author: Maggie M.

description:
I appreciate Double Decker's offerings but if I were to pay over $7 bucks for a burger I'd definitely choose Pearl's over Double Decker.

I ordered the buffalo burger, which is a cheeseburger with swiss cheese and buffalo wing sauce, plus typical burger fixings.  It was a good concept, but if I were to do it myself I would probably grill the patty with the sauce because it dripped too much off the lettuce.  I'd also like to suggest blue cheese instead of swiss.
author: Jenn C.

description: This review is for the burger, milkshake, and fries. I read all the other reviews about the tiny milkshake and the average-ness of all the other food, but reviews aren't always accurate. In this case they were, unfortunately. I paid $7.50 for an average (tiny) milkshake I wouldn't pay more than $2. The fries were soft and not at all crispy and the burger was average. And the prices were stupidly high. Not in a we're-in-SF-so-of-course-food-is-expensive way, in a 'this food is meh and the prices are equivalent to a hip Mission coffee shop'. Won't go back.
author: Amy S.

description:
Yeah, no. Paid $22 for the double decker burger and a large cobb salad through a delivery site. When it arrived, the salad was rather small, didn't come with bacon, and the burger didn't come with fries. How do you justify charging $9.50 for a burger with NO FRIES?! Called them up to ask for my money back and was met with the same rude service that I'm now seeing on many other reviews here. No compensation given, no apologies made, and no more orders from me. 

If you want a burger worth $9.50, there are plenty of other places serving them WITH fries and under that cost. This is not one of them.
author: Ian N.

description: Awesome burgers, one of the best in the city. Niman ranch beef and fries are pretty good too.
author: Kevin S.

description: Just finished my first meal here, and enjoyed it. Had the inferno wings which were just the right combination of spice, wing sauce, and vinegar. Very flavorful and not too hot. I will definitely be back!
author: Dave B.

description: We've order delivery here several times. The burgers are also amazing. The meat especially is really good quality. The patties are good sized, without being pub-sized big. My only complaint is that half the time they mess up our orders. Neither of us likes mayo, which we ask for without. They put the mayo on anyways. Very irritating. But the food is really good otherwise.
author: Rudy S.

description:
Note to self: Avoid watching the travel channel or food network. It gives you evil cravings haha. 

It's Wednesday night and I get home early from work. There is nothing on TV to watch. (day after the all star game = no sports) So I'm flipping channels and the travel channel comes up and what are they doing? They are doing a show on bar food.  Mainly buffalo wings. They look damn good. So I jump on Yelp to look up wings places and Double Decker pops up with Wednesday night all you can eat wings for $11.95. Omg it must be a sign from the food gods haha. I call my boy and convince him he wants wings and we need to rush over to make it before 8pm for the all you can eat special. We make and we grub. Wings are good. I mean its what you expect for wings haha. Mild and Hot form tasted about the same though we where too chicken to try the super duper burn your nose hair version. 

I am in pain now because i think i ate like 24 wings myself and I'm scared about what is gonna happen later with all that spicy wings and beer floating around in my stomach. (flaming butt hole) I would have to say if your hungry and a wing lover Wednesday night is the night you need to go to Double Decker. Small spot but 2 levels and very friendly service.
author: mitchell l.

description: This is the first time that I've been to a burger joint where the service is as bad as the location. The server was quite rude, he insisted that we already got our order already when we only received 5 out of the 6 burgers we ordered after waiting at least 30 minutes. Now we are waiting on the last burger while the others are getting colder by the minute. Service is slow and the workers did not look like they wanted to work nor did they smile or greet any customers coming in. I would not recommend this place, i recommend flippers, it is just around the corner
author: Chanson S.

description:
This is what we ordered:

*Original w/ american cheese
*Hawaiian w/ swiss
*Veggie burger w/swiss
** THE BURGERS WERE NOT GOOD. THE PATTIES WERE SUPER THIN AND NOT JUICY AT ALL.**

*Garlic Fries: they were really dry and not enough garlic
*Milkshakes: wayy too expensive. almost $6 for a reg to-go cup of milkshake...c'mon, reallyyy?
*Wings: soggy and greasy. i really did not enjoy this. im more of a saucy wings type of gal. did not satisfy my cravings.

Personally, I would not recommend this place to any of my friends. The prices online is not the same price as their restaurant's. We ended up paying a whopping $73 for all that above.

The ONE star is for the delivery service. We were quoted 1.5hrs but they came in a little over 45m.
author: Serena F.

description:
WAY over hyped. Was not up to expectations as stated by previous yelp reviews. 

First off, it was very difficult finding this place in the rain and second, the food was not as good as I thought it would be. I should have been warned by other follow yelpers, but I took a risk and tried this place anyway. I ordered the "double decker" burger and 6 wings during happy hour. the Wing were an okay deal at $3.50 but the burger at $8.95 I was expecting it to be amazing or at least something special, it wasn't. What a disappointment... The hot wings were small and warm, the burger was hot but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Food was okay, but if I had a choice to trek out here again, I don't think I would the next time.
author: Amy C.

description:
Little circular spot by the Days Inn. Oddly cool location. 

Wings: 
Got them hot. Good and the right amount of spicy.
A half dozen wings is normally $5.95, and a "buffalo dozen" (13) is $9.95. Go during happy hour though and you can get half dozen wings for $3.50 from 3-6pm M-F.

Burger:
My magic hangover cure today. Original burger costs $5.95 and was quite good other than the mayo. I hate mayo. 

Conclusion:
I liked the burger, but I'll probably stick to the wings from now on. SF has a million good burger joints but fewer good wing places.
author: Talia G.

description:
Congrats Dirty Decker, you get my first 1star review. 

I ordered food to go so I took a seat down inside with a partial view of the kitchen. I knew I was in for a treat when I saw a bag of frozen Kirkland Turkey burgers sitting on the counter. My excitement built when I saw the cashier repeatedly fingering burgers in the kitchen to check if the toppings were correct. Did I mention he didn't once wash his hands in the 30 minutes I was there. Things got more exciting when I watched the guy making my milkshake blow his nose repeatedly, no hand washing attempted. The fun continued as I watched incorrect orders get sent back to the kitchen where the cook scraped toppings off the burger only to regrill the patty, re-top with new condiments and send back to unsuspecting guests. All things aside, I still held hope for a tasty burger. Nope. Fool. A frozen over cooked patty tastes like a frozen over cooked patty. $30 for the worst burgers I've had in a long time. Save your money and go to Burger King if you want an overcooked prefab burger.
author: Michael O.

description: I ordered the double decker. When I heard recommendations that the double decker burger was fantastic, I knew I had to make the trip to this out of the way eatery. The unassuming place offered a pretty good burger. Meat was tender, and the way they used the onions offered a strong but unique taste I havent had on amy other burger. Solid and definitely above average
author: Gilbert L.

description:
Popped by here for some take out wings. I had a craving that could not be ignored. The guys running the place were very nice and friendly, and the food was surprisingly good. Gotta admit, we werent expecting much out of this little hole-in-the-wall.. But the wings were meaty, saucy and spicy! Perfect!

As decent as the wings were though, I'm only giving 3 stars because it's really not much of a dining establishment. Not very comfortable and certainly doesn't beg the diner to stay in. They'd win a few extra stars from me if their interior had a bit more to be desired.

Regardless, an enjoyable, very casual and affordable place for wings.
author: Tamara B.

description: tasty burger, would've been nice if he didn't immediately handle my food after handling the cash register, a little nasty.
author: glen f.

description:
Great take-out.  Delivery came 20 minutes quicker than expected.  Food was still hot.

Huge portions!  Burgers are delicious and HUGEEE!  The onion rings were tasty, bug and crispy.  The fries were okay b.c they should have been crispier, which is my only con. 

Prices are good!  However, I would say that $1.00 for a side of celery is pretty steep I think .50 would be a fairer price considering how cheap celery is.

Will reorder and I recommend.
author: Patrice M.

description:
BEST CHEESEBURGER to my memory. Ate here a month ago and ever since I've had a nagging craving to go back. So I went back yesterday, and damn if it wasn't great again! There is something about the taste of the burger that is perfect. Saw another reviewer decry them for putting garlic in the burger, if that's it then I'm all for it. Burger juicy, with great flavor and texture throughout. I also had the regular fries and they were just great as well. 

I can't imagine what the bad reviewers are complaining about, maybe the quality fluctuates? Dunno, until I hit a bad serving when I crave a burger and fries I am coming here.

Yum Double Decker!
author: Erik W.

description:
I was recommended to this place by a hairstylist at Oxenrose who raved a about it as possibly the best burger in the city.  But I've definitely had better.  I think I can give a reliable review as I've tried it twice now.

First time I had the beef burger.  It wasn't bad.  But nothing to write home about.  The fried chips were good.

The second time was the true disaster.  I picked the turkey breast burger.  I was expecting an actual breast, instead I got a round patty of reconstituted turkey parts.  And the steak fries?  I thought they cut their own potatoes!  No, I actually saw a guy hand the cook a frozen bag of fries to fry.  

I won't be going back.  I'll stick with Pearl's or Burger Joint.
author: J K.

description:
Tonight I discovered two things about myself.  The first thing I had already known somewhat, but the second thing surprised me.  I'll elaborate more in just a bit.

I stopped by Double Decker tonight.  I have seen this little restaurant in passing, and I always assumed it was the motel restaurant of the Days Inn located next door.  That's not the case at all, and thanks to Yelp and some very positive reviews I decided I wanted to try the burger here.

I ordered the Double Decker Burger and a small side of French Fries.  There's a photo of the burger posted by the restaurant in the photo section on Yelp, and I recalled it looked delicious.  It turns out that burger looks exactly like it did in that photo.  Two beef patties (they use Niman Ranch beef here), pickle slices, a lettuce leaf and both American and Swiss cheeses melted on top of the meat served in between a fresh seeded hamburger bun with just a slather of mayo on the bun.  Normally it comes with onions and tomatoes also, but I wasn't in an onion mood and asked to have it omitted.  Fresh tomato was cautiously left off due to the recent bad tomato episodes outside of California.  What'd I think?  It was a very good burger, and with each hot, juicy bite I could feel my arteries harden.  The fries were just a bit oily but excellent with a nice crispy exterior surrounding hot, meaty potato in the middle.

Discovery Number 1: There's an old Chinese saying that my parents use to use on me that loosely translates into, "The belly is full, but the eyes are not."  In other words, I'd be completely stuffed, but the sight of more food left me wanting more.  So there I was eating my burger as other patrons walked in to order Double Decker's Buffalo Wings.  I witnessed others enjoying these wings outside the restaurant, and I came to the conclusion that I had to try some wings too.  After I finished off my burger and fries I got up and ordered a half dozen Buffalo Wings.

The wings come in three degrees of heat - mild, hot and inferno.  Now I knew I couldn't handle really spicy foods, but I was certain I could handle something labeled simply as hot.

Discovery Number 2: I found out what a real wuss I am when it comes to eating Double Decker's "hot" Buffalo Wings because those wings left me sniffling and teary-eyed.  Dripping with a tangy, spicy sauce those wings were explosive.  I cried my way through the entire half dozen and happily enjoyed it.

Yes, I'll be back.  But the next time they see me here I'll take my wings on the mild side.  

What's better you ask?  The burgers or the wings?  My opinion ... you can't go wrong with either choice!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
THE WORST BURGER RESTURANT EVER!!! This place does not even deserve one star. My friend and I ordered chicken wings, fries, chips, salad, and a chicken breast burger.

The problems:
Buffalo wings-uncooked, included no sauce whatsoever, stale, cold
Fries-uncooked, cold
Chips-burnt
Chicken breast burger- stale chicken breast, cold

When I spoke to the manager, he was extremely rude and refused to issue us a refund.

Word of advice: PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!!
author: Anne D.

description:
The all you can eat wings here are delicious and really a very good deal at $12!! I had a dilemma originally deciding if I really wanted that many wings considering 13 wings is only $9...so in order to make it worth it I told myself I would have to eat more than one basketful. Turns out...not a problem! The mild wings I ordered were satisfying and paired perfectly with my $2.75 + 25% off Sam Adams, excuse me Vincent K., Henry Adams.

The celery here was also kind of amazing...surprisingly crisp, refreshing and stringless. Definitely a necessity when gorging on endless wings. Next time I will want more of the saturated with garlic fries and the chips looked pretty amazing too. I wish that they would bring buffalo wings in to the all you can eat... hint hint nudge nudge.

Tip: if you find that you are slowing down on the wings and want to ensure you get the bang for your buck, try playing Jenga with the finished chicken bones. Guaranteed to get you through another basket of goodness!!
author: Christina L.

description:
Very cool place... almost impossible to find!!
We walked around the streets within a 2 mile radius of this place for almost 45 minutes trying to find it. And just before we gave up... there it was! Right next to the holiday inn, a little round building.

The people inside were very nice, the place was quiet, and quaint. We ordered at the counter downstairs, and then went upstairs to wait. We didn't wait long, and the guy brought up our two burgers and two kinds of fries.

Everything was great, the burgers were very good but I think they might have been frozen patties. The regular fries and the garlic Parmesan fries were amazing! They actually use fresh herbs and fresh garlic on them... delicious!

We didn't try the wings but the other guy eating in the place had them, and he said they were very good. They smelled good too!
author: Julie A.

description:
Ambiance: a restaurant attached to a motel. The first floor is where the main counter is and there is additional seating upstairs.
Crowd: me and my friends after drinks at Smuggler's Cove
MEH: 6 wings and a cheeseburger. Nothing special.
Bottoms Up: just water.
Service: Friendly 
Notes: I like this place because it is really close to Smuggler's Cove. After drinking, it is always nice to eat something greasy. The food is unmemorable and gave me a stomach ache. I would rather go to In N Out!

Eat it. Meh. Try Really Hard Not To Repeat.
author: Jenna s.

description:
This spot is in my neighborhood. I love the hamburgers and fries. I also love it that they deliver in case I am too lazy to run over there. 

I like the California Burger best.
author: Dean C.

description: Frankly, I don't know what to make of this place. You will not be left hungry as the portions are large, but the place doesn't exactly scream clean, nor does it shout dirty. I enjoy their onion rings, and while the large and sweet tasting burgers are of a high quality beef, they also possess a tolerable gassy after-taste that I can't quite describe. When I'm in the mood to stay local and want a burger to fill me up good, I go here, but it's not my first choice when driving (Tony's Cable Car for the short car ride days). Good for take-out, but eating-in is uncomfortable, so I walk my food home. I'm on the fence about this place big time. I'll update.
author: Larry K.

description: Wait... It's 8pm and I can get a 9.5/10 burger delivered??? This place is what's up!! I used to come here 6+ years ago for affordable beer on tap and good food- years pass and this place still impresses me! Looks can be deceiving from outside, but GREAT old school tasting burgers fries onion rings shakes and owner/manager has a og/unique attitude to match! They have good selection of beer too -affordable and on tap!!
author: John O.

description:
The worst thing about this place is I gotta eat the leftovers.

Pay no heed to the positive reviews about the wings.  My double-dozen order of wings was meatless and sauce heavy.  The "hot" grade of sauce was quite mild;  I was hoping that I could at least fall back on eating something unusually spicy to save the meal.  No dice.

The service (delivery) was courteous and prompt.  Ain't gonna get me to call back, though.
author: Bill H.

description:
Nom nom nom! Thank you for the great burger, fries the way I like them,  really speedy delivery and nice delivery people!
 Next time I'm doing the double decker and the hot wings.
author: Tasha A.

description:
This place is probably good if you go in person, but the delivery experience has a few issues. I've gotten delivery from here twice and while everything tasted good, the food arrived lukewarm. The delivery time was reasonable, so I'm going to blame the temperature on lack of insulation during transport.

The burgers are easily the best thing to order. If that was the only thing I tried and it was the right temperature I would probably call this place four stars. The wings and chips are an interesting combo. The chips at the bottom soaking in sauce are great, but the wings don't really have much meat on them. The onion rings are pretty average, but make a good side for a burger. The milkshakes aren't bad, but I would call them slightly overpriced for the quality.

If you're thinking of trying this place, go in person and don't get the wings.
author: Cameron P.

description: Didn't expect much considering the reviews. No one was in the place. I waited 20 min for one burger. The cool did not drop the order for at least 10min. Then what appeared to be the manager started asking the counter guy questions about a bill or something while he was trying to work. Don't waste your precious time here for a subpar burger.
author: Kristian M.

description:
I am the least experienced wing-eater on Yelp, I'd assume. I think I have had wings a total of 4 times in my life. That being said, I loved the wings from here. They were super tasty, super spicy & the chicken itself was tender and delish!

My friend is so in love with their shakes, he got two. After he slurped down the first, he stared at the menu with that look of hesitation. It was a battle of self-will & it was glaringly apparently he didn't want to win. So, second shake he had.

I ordered a spinach salad & was presented with one of the biggest salads I've ever had in SF. (Firewood cafe may be in close competition) The way to win my heart is to give me a massive salad. It's easy & cheap enough to provide a customer with--make me feel like a veggie queen. Veggie queen I was. :) I've rarely met a salad I can't finish, but this I enjoyed two days in a row. 

Double Decker is an excellent, easy place to kick back and stuff yourself with delicious food. I most certainly recommend!
author: Tawnee K.

description:
Now THIS is how a burger should taste.

I've been here twice now and both times, I was completely satisfied with my Double-Decker burger. The patty was just heavenly and cooked to perfection. Most importantly, the burger was constantly juicy to the very last bite. Now that's how a burger is supposed to be.

I definitely recommend Double Decker burger for the burger enthusiast. It may not have the recognition and prestige as other burger joints in the City, but with their burgers, they should be well on their way.
author: Tom P.

description:
The inside isn't the prettiest nor the cleanist, but the Hawaiian Burger is tasty and the garlic fries are usually crispy. Reasonably priced and made with Niman Ranch, I stop here every once in a while for a quick grease fix.

I usually end up fairly satisfied, but the last time I ate there my burger was overly rare, cold, and fairly flavorless. The fries had way to much garlic for me (and I LOVE GARLIC) and were pretty soggy and cold.

I much prefer Flipper's in Hayes. I feel like it's a bit more consistent.
author: KA K.

description:
-Fries are pretty good. Nice and crunchy.
-Milkshake is overpriced at $6 and really small. But the chocolate is really really really chocolatey and thick.
-Didn't get to try the burgers or wings :(
-Free delivery and the people there are super nice.
author: Aron L.

description:
Nothing special. The salad ingredients appeared to be fresh, but I wouldn't be shocked if the patties were frozen. The buns are nothing special. There was no added flavor or spice ot the meat. A few blocks NE is Krave that has same or better prices for tastier fare. 

Ambiance - Fast food to go, though they do deliver. 
Service - Poor. When the guy was talking to me, he was polite enough, but he wasn't actually listening enough to get my order right (even though I clarified a couple of points twice). He was ALWAYS on his cell phone when he was bringing my food to my table. 
Food - Mediocre, nothing special. Note: I did not try the wings which many folks seem to rather like. 
Price - Not great for what you get. $6 for a half salad. $6 for a very small milkshake. $1.25 for a can of soda.
author: Kat S.

description:
Good wings-cheap!
Good beer-$3 a pint (happy hr)
Burgers are pretty good too, not something to brag about, but you get what you pay for. We stop for wings, they are worth it!
author: Kristie H.

description: Small place but gopd food.  Need some rearrangement in the shop to attract more people.
author: D P.

description: Its a chill spot the people are cool. Burgers are decent, but the wing are bomb. This spots really about the wings especially if u like em hot.
author: Bantu Z.

description:
Great burgers, tasty wings, yummy Mitchell's ice cream in the essential three basic flavors.

Service is good in this funny little spot.  The happy hour is essential, as the wings are a bit on the expensive side. HH has a deal on wings and small sides.

They make sweet potato fries, which is a plus, and their "Inferno" sauce is not for the faint of heart.  Variety of non-spicy and sufficient variations on the classic wing sauce.

And it's a weird nobby end of a hotel in Hayes Valley, what's not to love?  My favorite is to go there before hitting up the SF Symphony.
author: Jen G.

description:
Simple. Tasty. Quick.  Double Decker is really delicious and perfect for what it does.

This place is literally the antithesis of Flipper's burgers just a couple blocks away on Hayes.  Instead of many gourmet burgers, DD has like 4 really well done simple burgers.  I have to say that on a purely burger level, this place reminds me of a favorite place back home called the Owl (which also does a really amazing simple burger).  

The meat patty here is slightly thin and cooked just right.  Then it's loaded up with a good portion of toppings and handed off.  It's just hard to describe it any other way.  The fries were only average (or a little above), but I didn't even care to be honest.

I'll definitely go back and try a different burger on the menu.

Oh and they deliver.

Snap.
author: Nicholas N.

description:
Average burger and fries. 

This place is not clean as it could be. If I was the owner, I'd want my employees to help clean when there's downtime rather than watch tv.
author: Vicky C.

description:
Minus one star for being small place, really small. 

Had the AYCE wings and ordered the inferno, omg I didn't expect it to be that spicy :0 I realize the name is inferno but by the look of the place I thought they would be more like hot. Upstairs they have a free water fountain, which I deff took advantage of after eating a bucket of inferno wings.  they don't have servers it's more of a order at the counter and then sit down place; however, the staff was really nice and attentive. 

They have a solid happy hour if your lucky to snag a table. $2 pint of blue moon during HH :)
author: Laura I.

description:
Love this place.  The location is kind of funny at the Day's Inn, but that's part of the charm.  They always have a couple of beers on tap, have either ESPN or the Discovery Channel on, and it's good for delivery/take-out.  I like a regular or veggie California burger (swiss cheese, avocado) with fries.  The garlic fries are super garlicky - yum!

I had a milkshake once and was disappointed - I had high expectations for Mitchell's ice cream.  But they have beer, so no biggie.
author: Sarah D.

description: Good but not wonderful. Will work as your standby hamburger for when you are craving a big ol burger but want delivery.  They got the order wrong and I got regular fries but the order of garlic fries was missing. Bummer. The regular fries didn't taste like fresh cut potatoes, but they were good, not great. Just okay for me.
author: Piper W.

description: I ordered a cheddar cheese burger with a side of small onion rings and ate it there. Seating is very limited because the place is really tiny (and grimy). The patty was cooked well-done. I believe pretty much all the ingredients are things you can get at Costco, and it tasted like a "free burger" you'd get at a college club meeting/bbq. The onion rings were okay except they used the super outer skin of the onion, which is the chewy part. So whenever you bit into an onion ring, you couldn't bite through it. Maybe I just need sharper teeth to compensate for it, I dunno.
author: H. L.

description:
pretty awesome food if you're into fatty foods! small place with an upstairs dining area attached to days inn.. a little awkward, but sure. seems like its a family owned restaurant, maybe a chinese family? either way, the food we ordered was delicious!

original double decker burger- one of the juiciest burgers ive ever had! my first bite surprised me because it was so GOOD.

garlic fries- pretty garlicy to me. freshly made. i love garlic so when i order something garlic, it better be STINKY!

dozen buffalo wings- these are probably one of the best ive had. we ordered hot, no inferno, because i wanted to enjoy eating these wings after a long day.
author: Christine C.

description:
I used to order burgers there at least twice a month a few months ago.
Today I placed my order and gave my address suddenly he said is this china town? I said no russian hill.
He told me they are short (who knows what that means) and they don't deliver that far out anymore. There was nothing what indicated that they don't deliver in specific areas. Update your stupid web site.
Never will call this burger joint again.
Burgers are always cold when they arrive anyways.
author: Sandy W.

description:
This place is good.....and it delivers!  The wings are good.  There is also a really good happy hour from 3pm to 6 pm that is really good.  I forgot the exact price, but I think it was $2 for some quality draft beers.  The place is kind of small though, so expect to go on a sunny day or pay the $15 minimum for a great delivered meal! 

The burgers are great and the wings are spicy tasty.  Meaning they are not exactly spicy, but just enough, where it's tasty!
author: Min P.

description:
Simple place that gets the menu right, and sticks to the basics.

Attached to the side of a Days Inn, Double Decker isn't a standout by any means, but they do deliver a solid burger, and a mean basket of wings.

It's an odd shaped venue, with a u shaped first floor and a few tables hugging it's edges. The owner is a gentle guy, that is cognizant of the level of his establishment, which is the only taste of true character in this place.

It's a cozy place for a quick bite, a cold pitcher of brew, and I'm interested in coming back for their All You Can Eat Wings on Wednesdays.
author: Mike K.

description: DO I HAVE TO GET THIS PLACE A STAR I WISH NOT I WALKED IN THE GUY BEHIND THE COUNTER SAID (what you want !!!) i said OK a lil rod here i said can i have a menu i never been here before he said ( their right their ) in a rod way so i just walked out and said i will spend my money some were happy
author: Don H.

description:
Ordered some delivery.

Food was below average.

Ranch tasted pretty nasty.

Fries were soggy.
author: Mark W.

description:
First off, the place is nothing fancy. In fact, it's pretty grungy. The service is lacking, and when you eat there, you're inevitably going to smell like fried food (duh), so plan accordingly.

Their wings have been a hit or miss for me. But mostly a hit, which is why this place gets 3 stars.. And their deals are hard to beat.  

Not a place I'd generally recommend, but if you're craving wings and don't feel like paying a high price for simply being at a bar, come here. Hopefully, you won't be disappointed.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Sad excuse of an eatery. Came here to try the wings. Given that I'm a wings connoisseur, I don't blame this place too much. But:

We ordered the inferno and hot. There's no depth in flavor. There's not enough butter in the hot sauce for the sauce to cling onto the wings. Meat was dry and wilting like they've been pre-cooked and dried out for hours and then quick fried to serve. Inferno was the same flavor (or lack of such) only with a hot sensation, not a spicy taste. Very single-dimensional. 

Blue cheese dressing was definitely from a bottle. Tasted and textured like cornstarch with white-out. 

I don't know what you guys were thinking. Again, open up your mind and educate your palates, Yelpers. Drag your asses to Capital on 839 Clay in Chinatown and order the salt and pepper wings. Your taste buds will thank ME, amateurs.
author: DANIEL T.

description: I'm not really a burger person but the food is pretty good and the inside is cute. I like their sides even better though, especially the chips. I could just eat bags of those in one sitting, and I think they're homemade.
author: a f.

description: this place has great food.other than disrespectful Hispanic cook lady.she is very rude.if the wings weren't as good as they are i wouldnt return.or until i find an equivalent wing place i guess ill have to put up with the ladys unpleasantness.
author: David S.

description:
When I was in a pinch and needed a boatload of wings for a Mad Men season finale party, Double Decker came through. $30 for 50 wings delivered to my door? Sounds like a deal! 

If you like 'em spicy, definitely go with the inferno...I'm normally a medium spicy guy but even I was able to suck down a couple of the inferno wings.

Good stuff, I wouldn't hesitate to order from Double Decker in the future.
author: phil h.

description: Double Decker has provided consistently good food and unbeatable prices throughout my years of business with them, however I am specifically writing this to recognize how they've stepped up their game. In recent weeks they've upgraded to a hearty veggie patty that would even satisfy a meat lover. The salad I ordered this evening came with two dressings, what seemed like an entire tomato and half an avocado and cucumber. The fries were abundant and crispy with plenty of ketchup to go around. Double Decker has also always been great with customizing orders. I've replaced standard meat patty burgers with veggie patties without any issues or mistakes. Dining in or waiting for a to-go order provides a cozy space with sports on the television, and a beer to chug while waiting. Am I biased because I live nearby? Maybe, but I'm glad they're there.
author: K B.

description:
I finally got off my ass and got to Double Decker to do my job of consuming their burger and sharing my experience with you guys.  It's a strange little space connected to a Day's Inn Motel on Grove between the Opera House and The Western Addition.  I normally don't trust restaurants that cover walls and windows with photo's of their food, but this joint looked like they posted their own pictures and they are authentic.  A cool young Asian dude took my order and he's like in your face the second you enter the doorway.  I thought it was really tiny until he told me I could wait for my food upstairs, but I chose a table out front on the street instead.

I usually opt for a restaurants signature menu item so here I ordered the Double Decker, a soda and fries and outside I went where I waited about five or ten minutes for my grub.  There was a steady stream of customers coming in and leaving, so food was always being cooked but there was no frantic feeling.  I was happily surprised when the guy who took my order appeared with two red plastic baskets containing my delicious looking burger 1st and my fries 2nd.  The burger consisted of two patties, one draped with melted swiss, the other with melted cheddar, cooked to perfection resting on a toasted sesame bun.  A wide swath of mayo covered the bottom under the meat, and there were pickles, tomato, onion and lettuce on the side.  

The fries were obviously house cut rather than frozen and had the added pleasure and taste of being twice cooked or pre-blanched which adds depth and richness to the fries, delicious!  My first bite into this thick and gorgeous burger was heavenly, hot juices, good meat, melted cheeses and a toasted bun are beautiful things when put together like this.  I didn't give this place a 5th star because there was a lingering taste that just didn't match all the other great attributes of the place, but I have no idea if that was me on a bad day or something in one of the ingredients.  But I give this place high marks for quality, cleanliness, pricing and presentation, and I'll go back soon and double check that taste question.  This is a good burger joint that sells much more than a burger.
author: Stu S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place since I've read decent reviews & now work in the area. I even read a review from Rufus D. who had a bad experience with his fries.
I went with the double decker I believe it's called. I wasn't impressed one bit, you'd figure It would be delicious since it's their signature burger...
Where it gets worse, i ordered as well a side of fries...Just my luck!  Found a hair right on top! How could they have missed that?? It totally ruined my 30 mns lunch! 
After pointing it out to the cashier, I asked for my money back which he did return but not one apology or anything...
Guess they lost my business because I sure do love my burgers!
author: Fabien F.

description: Basic. Cali burger with cheddar instead of swiss. Beer. Approved.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
call me crazy, but wings should be their own amazing food group!!! I am always on the look out for a great wing that has great taste as well as flavor and kick, 

The wings at Double Decker are a good wing for a great price. 
Let the wings sit in the sauce for a bit....  AMAZING TASTE!!!!
13 wings for around 10 bucks 
3 flavors mild/hot/inferno 
decent blue cheese. 
The draft beer is cheap and there is one TV to watch the games... may not be the place to watch a whole game/games, but a great place to start the day!! 

NOTE.... WEDNESDAY is all you can eat wings from 4-7pm for 14 dollars!!!!
author: Zac G.

description:
4 stars?  Really?  Maybe I came on an off night.  Or maybe I should have ordered wings.

Here's a breakdown:

Burgers:
Mine was ok, but not memorable.  If you're looking for a burger in Hayes Valley, it's worth it to walk to Flippers down the street.

Milkshake:
I had a sip of my friend's chocolate milkshake...me thinks not!  It tasted like it was made from some powder or instant mix.

Atmosphere:
Attached to a Days Inn in a questionable area, it was a bit underwhelming.  I couldn't see how this place could accommodate a lot of people.

Service:
I had met up with my friends late so they did all the ordering, but by the time I got there, some of them were just getting their food after waiting 35 minutes.  For a burger or a chicken sandwich?  Um, did they have to go out and slaughter the animal first?  

My friend who also arrived late tried to order a salad, and there was some drama because at first, the guy said they weren't taking more orders.  The place was still supposed to be open though, so I don't know why this was such an issue.  

Overall, since I got there late, I didn't get to experience much of it first hand, when your 5 other friends are in a bad mood after experiencing the service, it makes you apprehensive to want to get more food, and it does affect your dining experience when your eating companions aren't happy.

At the end, the guy who was working there seemed like he was trying to be more accommodating, but it got to that "there's been so much dramz that the chefs may spit in our food" point, and we just wanted to leave as soon as possible.

Menu:
Hmm, are there any healthy options?  My friend got a salad, but it was mainly iceberg lettuce and cheese from what I saw.  It's San Francisco in the 21st century.  At least try to sprinkle in a few leaves of romaine.  

In light of all these factors, I gave it 2 stars because I save my 1 star designations for places you'd have to drag me screaming tooth and nail to go inside.  I may go back and try these infamous wings that everyone else seems to rave about, but if I want a burger/diner experience, you can find me at Flippers down the street.
author: Alice C.

description:
After bay to breakers, where can two people get some food, who are not drunk, not joggers, desiring fish and chips but have some standards left after a camping weekend?  Since we live on the same street as the mad crazy race, we had to travel quite far.  On the way, we encountered all the people who dropped out of the race before it reached Masonic.  

The further and further we went, the less and less glitter and neon.  Finally I convinced the BF to come to this little non-descrit place.  I'm not sure he enjoyed his burger, he's not one to be descriptive regarding food.  I got the buffalo dozen in hot.  And it was hot.  Better yet, there was actually enough blue cheese dressing for the wings.  

The wings were nicely fried.  Crispy thin skin.  Though drenched in sauce that was firey hot, there was not a bit if fat.  It was a bit salty.  I liked them.  Maybe I should not have it quite so spicy next time.  In my old age, I cannot handle as spicy as I used.  

The French fries were a bit shriveled.  I'm assuming that this is because they were fresh cut rather than blanched.  No matter what those effing hippies tell you, fresh cut things are not always better.  Fries are infinitely better after they have been blanched.  

The area is shit and I would not walk around here at night by myself.  I would not even get off the bus near here, get take out and then run for the bus back.   If it was not for the BF, I would not have eaten here.  Alright I'm afraid of getting shot.

** previous errors, inconsistencies, inexplicable contradicting phrases are blamed on the iPad.  All blame the iPad.
author: Christina C.

description:
Obviously my previous post contributed to their overall business plan.  So they have changed their happy hour recently from the awkward "25% off" that resulted in weird prices to $1 small sides, $2 beers, and $3 buffalo wings.

The sides are pretty good, but I think the happy hour small is less than the usual small.  Also, the garlic fries are from the bottom of the bag as they were tiny fries.  However, the onion wings are on point.  You can't go wrong with the $2 pints as long as you get there before 6pm.  

If you are going for the wings, get the INFERNO wings or go home!
author: Joey S.

description:
Rating: 4.5 STARS
A place that has buffalo wings and burgers is always a great place to get your grub on. A place that does both really good is hard to find. But this place takes the cake. Their burgers are fresh, hearty, and tastes amazing. Their wings are the BEST I have had in SF, better than Pizza Place on Noriega. The wings are cooked perfectly, not too dry, but has a good crisp to them. The sauce...man...the sauce they use embodies everything that a buffalo sauce should taste like. It has a little tang, with good amount of spicy (not over powering). Not to mention their homemade blue cheese sauce with chunks of blue cheese...aww man...this place has all the bells and whistles when it comes to their food.

Be sure to check out their Happy Hour: M-F 3-6pm sides(french fries, potatoe salad, onion rings...etc. JUST $1, beers JUST $2. 

The only thing that is kind of weird is their location. They are located right next to DaysInn Motel, and they have very limited seating. But other than that, this is a GEM in SF.
author: Nick C.

description:
There's something to be said about offering a small amount of menu items, but doing them right. Focus is a good thing. Double Decker is an example of sparse menu, but well done items. Burgers and chicken wings; that's what you get. 

The burgers are made from Niman Ranch beef, served with the usual condiments. We opted for the spicy chicken wings and they came to us perfectly greasy, hot and dripping with spice. 
 
Bonus is they make their shakes with Mitchell's ice cream. Using good quality ice cream makes such a difference. 

The atmosphere at Double Decker is borderline bizarre. The kitchen/ordering area is located on the ground level of a seedy looking motel. There is a second dining area upstairs, but you have to walk up the motel stairs and by the rooms to get there. I guess this set up explains the Double Decker name of the place. 

Strange floor plan aside, Double Decker does a good job at the basics.
author: Lee H.

description:
I've doubled Double Decker's rating because of their AYCE (all-you-can-eat Wednesday wing night)!  It's $11.95 per person (4pm-8pm) and you get them in batches of ten or so at a time and you can switch up how hot and spicy you want them which is nice.  They also have happy hour  on Mon - Fri, 3:00pm to 6:00pm and it's 25% off on all Sides, Buffalo Dozen, & Tap Beers so a great deal. 

Wings are solid and the traditional Buffalo style.  Not those mealy nasty Hooters ones. Woot!
author: Gene X.

description:
This place is great, I'm on the brink of giving it 5 stars. The wings and fries were good, but I actually think the burger is the best part. I got the California burger and it was awesome. Avocado, cheese... what is there not to like?

I like the guy that works there too, and it's kind of cool when they bring you your food upstairs... it's a weird set up but I don't mind it.
author: Abbey S.

description:
I ordered delivery from them - $15 minimum, which is understandable. The prices were fairly reasonable, kinda. The burgers are $7-9 and the sides are $2 (no, burgers don't come with fries. I still don't get this).


Took them an hour and fifteen minutes to deliver - the dude was very apologetic, but now I'm starving, staring at cold chicken wings, old fries and a luke warm burger. Can't really comment on the tastiness, other than it tastes like shit cold. Boooo! $20 down the drain. Grrrr...
author: Natalie S.

description:
Double dozen hot wings(26)
Pineapple chicken burger w/ steak cut fries(sm)

1. Chk your order.. i ordered steak cut fries and got regular fries. Sorry, it is a big deal, especially when i paid extra for steak cut fires!
2. Definitely a take out or delivery place. Interiors is not suitable to sit down and have a meal w/ your friends.
3. weird atmosphere. 
4. Place looked/felt/tasted(food) like it belongs to a food truck in the mission. Sorry. Was not so Hayes Valley like.
5.Food: Wings sucked. Simply fried, hot sauce etc but it did not taste good at all. Pineapple burger, blah, mushy and not good.

I am happy i tried this place. Now i know i will not be wondering about it. I would love to find an awesome wing place in the city tho.
Go and you be the judge.
author: C A.

description:
Great Service, Great Food, what else can you ask for.

I had the California Burger and fresh cut chips. Probably one the best burgers I've ever had and the chips are to die for. Real Potato Chips!!!!!

Definitely a place to stop when ever I'm in the city!!
author: William W.

description: Got Sunday football deliver of wings and onion rings. The wings definitely impressed me-- still warm when they arrived, really spicy, and all around some of the best wings I've had. The only negatives were that they charge $1 extra to make them spicy, and 50 cents each for bleu cheese dip and celery. The onion rings were really good as well, but there definitely weren't very many rings in a "large" order.
author: Will A.

description:
Ordered for delivery at noon on superbowl sunday. 90 minutes to be delivered which was twice the amount quoted, but not terrible for the superbowl.

Garlic fries were pretty good, probably the best part of the meal.
Burgers were mediocre. Slightly above hospital cafeteria food.
"Bucket" of "wings"... tiny, shriveled, dried out pieces of meat wrapping (mostly) broken bones. 

I won't order again.
author: Dan P.

description:
This is not the best burger you will ever have, but it is a GOOD BURGER. 

If you live in the neighborhood and want to get down on some ground beef without having to deal with grease all over your back splash, walk here. Order a cheeseburger w/ cheddar cheese & a large fries, to share with your hubby or whoever. Ask for no salt on the fries so you can salt to taste and order a shake too, what the heck. 

Although I'll warn you, their straws are painfully narrow and you will run the risk of bursting a blood vessel, trying to suck down the thick Mitchell's ice cream. 

I ordered chocolate, but wished I had gotten strawberry. Do yourself a favor and learn from my mistake.
author: miss L.

description:
I have an idea.

Yeah?

Let's start a REALLY good little restaurant.

Ok.

Let's serve burgers, fries, insanely good hot wings, shakes, and local San Francisco ice cream, you know, something all American.

Sounds delicious.

Yeah, and I want to name it after those buses in London!

Sounds awe...wait, what?

Regardless of whatever they wanted to call this place, Double Decker is friggin delicious.  

The hot wings and fries went down easier than the new cherry flavored Alka-Seltzer (trust me, this I know).

Marketing.
author: Archie R.

description:
I ordered through GrubHub and it came an hour later.  We were starving...

The California Veggie Burger was good, everything tasted fresh.  The garlic fries tasted a bit funky.  They were really soggy and stale tasting.  The ranch was also very funky, and not in a good way.  Good thing I have a secret stash of Clorox-Branded Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing in my fridge!
author: Paran Y.

description:
Good burgers.

Niman Ranch makes a damn good burger. They use Niman ranch, so they make damn good burgers here, obviously. I honestly didn't expect much because this place is the size of some dude's closet but WOW! mucho sabor!!!

Gotta say, great place to eat when you're downtown and not very expensive at all. Fed three people, with sides, for less than $30. Haven't tried their wings but they smelled delicionable.

Garlic fries were not soggy. They were tasty, fresh, and yummy!!!

TL;DR: Great place to eat, not much money, good burgers.
author: Joshua G.

description:
QUICK REVIEW:
Best wings I've had in San Francisco.  Crispy with good heat without being sour.  Go for the all-you-can-eat or happy hour specials.  The owners are very friendly too.  I'm sure I'll be back.

THE DETAILS:
I had the all-you-can-eat special for 11.95 and the homemade chips.  If you're not going to eat a lot, then the 1/2 price dozen wings during happy hour (M-F 3-6pm) is a great deal.

The wings are on the small side but I suppose it's not a big issue when it's all-you-can-eat.  They were nice and crispy, which is how I like them, but they are heavily sauced so the crispiness goes down a bit if you let them swim in the sauce for too long.

I started with the inferno, which was surprisingly spicy.  It had a good flavor without being overly sour, which is problem with a lot of wing sauces.  I've had hotter wings before, but these were pretty spicy.  After I finished my original 13, I decided to try the hot.  These were OK but the inferno had more flavor, so I went back to the inferno.

The fresh potato chips were an interesting option.  They were good, but nothing special.  I'll try the fries next time.
author: Richard C.

description:
Remember once upon a time when I said I'd go to Jade bar and have like, 6 cocktails? Well, um, yeah. I did. And what happens after those 6 said drinks? Well, if you haven't eaten dinner, then it's a hunger pang with the white hot intensity of a thousand suns or M.I.A.'s outfit at the Grammy's. 

Thankfully, no one else was in there at our group's hour of shame. There was about 6 of us, and we immediately went to town and ordered burgers, fries, wings, beer and sandwiches. I had the chicken sandwich, which was actually very good. The mild wings were spicy, and well, not that special. The garlic fries though? So good going in, but so awful going out--and by that i mean my breath, people. I seriously brushed my teeth twice before bed, rinsed around 3 am because I felt like someone painted the roof of mouth with glue and minced garlic and again in the morning! Those things linger--I warn you. Enjoy them in the moment, for you will be forever alone until their magic dies. 

Good prices, open til around 9 I believe and just divey enough to make me feel special. I'm sure they get quite the crowds.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Tonight one yelper did the unimaginable - he ate 31 inferno wings at Double Decker. The setting? 10 yelpers sitting around a table taking full and complete advantage of DD's Wednesday Night Special - all-you-can-eat-wings for $11.95.

There is no end to Double Decker's awesomeness. It took over the old sushi joint some time ago and turned this extension of the Day's Inn into a shrine for wing worshipers. The wings come in three degrees of spicy: mild, hot and inferno, with that perfect blend of crunchy skin and tender insides. Fries and Niman Ranch hamburgers are also on the menu.

I have to admit, after eating a basket of wings, I felt like checking myself into the Day's Inn for some rehabilitation. How convenient that it's attached to a hotel!
author: Nicole G.

description:
The quick-and-dirty:
Some of the worst service I've received.  Ever.  Add to that the overcooked burgers, limited menu, and long waiting time and you've got yourself a Double Decker of worthlessness.  The get 1 star for location, chocolate milkshake, and wings.  Otherwise, 0 stars.
-Terrible Service
-Mediocre Food
-No Atmosphere

The back-story:
We wanted to get a quick burger/fries type meal on a Saturday night so that we could get the night going.  Unfortunately, Double Decker wasn't the place for quick...

5 of us arrived and put in our order.  The 6th texts hers to us, so we order up an extra burger.  The 7th follows suit and we order up a salad.  Except, at this point, they just can't handle making a salad in addition to the rest of our order...5 burgers, a chicken sandwich, a couple of sides, and now a salad.  Really?  Too difficult to handle?  Finally, after an hour and a half and 3 attempts to order the salad, it arrives in a takeout container.  Now, we can finally be on our way to start our Saturday night mayhem.

Besides the awful service, my burger was really overcooked (I'd ordered "medium") and no one enjoyed their food.  The wings were good, I will give them that, but definitely not worth going back for.
author: John B.

description:
"It tastes like...burning!" 
-Ralph Wiggum 

Okay, so it didn't exactly taste like burning, not at first anyway, but the inferno wings sure do pack some heat in there. On first bite you'll think to yourself that it's not so bad and that the people getting up every 2 minutes for more water are just wimps. However, this heat creeps up on you, and next thing you know you're only trying to finish the damn thing in order not to look like a wuss. They're good though, and I can see their addictive properties. Definitely not complaining. The hot wings also live up to their name, and I ate several of those. Blue cheese dressing is served as a dip, as are celery sticks for cooling purposes. 

The fries are pretty good - slightly crispy with the skin still on. They reminded me of a somewhat thicker version of In-n-Out's fries but more irregularly-shaped. It wouldn't surprise me if they've never been frozen. However, I'd definitely forgo the burger ($5.95, no sides) next time - they do advertise Niman Ranch beef and while I'm sure they're not lying, I found the beef a little bland and the color slightly unappetizing. I can get something yummier from In-n-Out for cheaper. 

No fountain soda, but they do have beer so it balances out. I like the upstairs area that can be reserved for groups, though I'd imagine if you weren't sitting up there it'd be hard to eat in as the space downstairs is very limited. 

Some of the wings and the occasional fry had these weird stringy packaging material attached to them - at first I thought it was hair, but the consistency was different enough to where I'm pretty sure it wasn't. However, it was a little gross, and it's the reason it's a 3 - after all, I'm not going to seriously penalize a wings joint for not having a good burger. 

Overall it was pretty okay, and the Wednesday all-you-can-eat wings for $11.95 is a really good deal - odds are I'll be back, but not for the burger.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Divey atmosphere.  BEST GARLIC FRIES EVER.

The -1 star was not for the atmosphere, but for the fact that they close at 9pm on the weekends.  What the heck are they thinking?  After my $2 beers at Jade, there is nothing I want more than a bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries at a decent food-to-money-spent ratio.  The service was quick.  The burger was excellent.  The fries were the stuff of food orgasm.

Warning: the garlic fries may or may not cause an entire night of garlic burps, depending on whether you are a delicate female flower (like me, naturally) that does not burp (good heavens!  for shame!), or a hearty man's man that lets his flatulence fly.  Yum.  I mean, ew, gross.

There is no reason to eat that much garlic, except that you can.  And you should.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Be warned that the Inferno wings are extremely hot.  There's habanero peppers in the sauce; I can taste the slightly sweet and yet extremely hot goodness.  About a third of the way into the basket of wings the spiciness hit me.  I drank almost a half gallon of water with the rest of the wings in the basket.

The wings here are damn near perfect.  The wings were not over-breaded and it was a sublime combination of crispy fried wing with sauces that are hot but not salty at all (butter is often the thickener in buffalo wing sauce).  The wings were still crispy after being drenched in sauce.

All you can eat wings was not a bad choice, even if I will suffer consequences from the Inferno wings.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Really?? You call those buffalo wings?!?!?

I can't believe I agreed to eat here. I have tried many, many good wings but this one is right at the bottom of the pit. The wings tasted like the kind you buy frozen at the grocery store. I think they were pre-cooked (sitting under a heat lamp all day), then reheated, and slathered with some red sauce sold in a 55 gallon drum. I'm not sure about the burgers but I guess I'll never find out.

I shall not return - ever!

I'm not impressed. You get what you pay for and then some crack whore asks you for spare change on the way out.

PS. The dining room is upstairs - cold with bad fluorescent lighting.
author: Sam H.

description:
Great place from which you can order online easily and have it delivered quickly!
Pros:  great shakes, although not worth $6. They need to work on that, even if it does contain Mitchell's ice cream.  Fast delivery (worth mentioning twice). Good onion rings & fries that stay crisp by the time they're delivered. Good comfort food if you're in the mood!
Cons: they need to update the site to tell you what's included on the burgers 'cause I hate onions & always forget to ask them to not put them on.
I like to keep it simple so that's it...rather than ramble & over analyze a friggin' burger delivery joint.
author: Scott S.

description:
The wings were well-prepared and tasty, which, really, is the most important (i.e. Useful) thing to know. The "hot" sauce was mild on the first couple bites but then built up and brought some heat. The included celery, ranch, and bleu cheese were nice touches. I was very disappointed that the fries were overcooked and tough; I was counting on them to counter the spicy sauce. Unlike the wings, they did not reheat well, either. (I had hoped nuking them would soften and improve the fries; no luck.) 

The delivery process was fine. Had to speak slowly when placing the order, though. My food arrive in 40 minutes, which fit the 30-45 minute timeframe I was quoted. Props for including ketchup packets and a big stack of napkins in the bag. To really step it up, it'd be great if they included a couple moist towelettes for cleaning up afterward.

Still, my officemate was a bit jealous and I was a happy camper by the end of my lunch. I look forward to going to the restaurant itself for the Wednesday night all-you-can-eat wings.
author: Bill B.

description:
If you happen to stay at the Days Inn on Grove near Gough, you'll be happy to know right at the end of the wing, you BY GOSH, can get WINGS.  and not just any wings, if its Wednesday night, you can get ALL YOU CAN EAT wingfest! ($12)  this goes on from 4pm to 8pm.  And to seal the deal, theres Happy hour from 4-6pm with 25% off sides and drinks.  btw, Onion rings and fresh cut fries are great.  mos def!

I don't know how it might be for some, but for me, that's quite a deal there.  and with the cheap beers (Happy Hour = $2.25) I had a blast scarfing myself down with chicken wings.  and might I suggest the hot ones since it tends to be more moist and saucy.  Mild is great,but it's a little bit on the crispy side and the meat is drier.  Definitely better than Original Buffalo Wings hands up.

Although the spot is quite small with two weirdly end shaped rooms, it does make for a cozy setting and you'll have to come early to get the seats if you have a large party.  The service is great too!  They let us pay for 9 beers for happy hour but hold on till later past 6pm to get them.  One of the guys even gave us a free beer for letting him use the bathroom first.  Good food, good company, friendly people, cozy seting, yes! I think I'll have to come back again next time and get more of the sides too like the fresh cut chips!
author: Vincent K.

description: It is not fancy up in here, the burgers (and wings) are good, the counter guys are nice and its easy to pop-in and pop-out again without too much fuss or expense.  The Hawaiian burger is SUPER yummy, ask the cook to grill the pineapple.
author: Miss Information X.

description: Great happy hour.  Not a fancy place, just a hole in the wall spot that sells beer by the pitcher and hot wings.
author: G R.

description: Double Decker makes a completely satisfactory burger, for the price it's sold at some might even call it a fantastic burger. I go here on my lunch break and almost always find it populated by construction workers amicably chatting away as the enjoy their burgers. The beef is responsibly raised, the veggie burger is pretty good, and again, the price is fantastic. So far, this is the only "everyday" lunch place with "everyday lunch" prices.
author: Nik K.

description:
crisp sauced chicken wings.....mild, hot o' inferno options...paper lined plastic baskets serving....three levels of heat....although fairly small gaps to heat extremes.....noting inferno quite hot....but, not worthy of inferno title....drip of sweat and some kick...fairly manageable with gulp of sierra, samuel adams or hefeweizen pints/pitchers available tap...hot being hot...smaller kick, still spicy for average joe....mild being mini-hot....consensus mild is hot enough and possible better choice for wednesday all-you-can-eat gluttony....

finding homemade potatoe chips greasy good...$7 burgers and chicken sandwiches sub-par in preparation and construction....but, burgers looking quite handsome....overall, forget about it....wings are good....and nothing more....mention 9pm closing...no late night wing and beer binge....roughly $12 wednesday night all-you-can-eat wings.....$12 standard pitchers 4 pints exact....standard options of $9 for 13 wings enough for self.....
author: Hen A.

description:
Undoubtedly the best wings place in SF. I treat myself once every month with a dozen of the "inferno" wings dipped in some extra inferno buffalo sauce and believe me, they are awesome!!!.... Inferno wings, fries and beer, what else do you want?? 

I like it super hot and spicy and so I always get the inferno one. But they have mild and hot ones as well and they are as good as they can get. I recommend very highly if you LOVE wings. I haven't tried the burgers, may be I will never as thats the signature wing place for me in SF. But hey, I heard that they are as good as the wings!!...
author: Judhajit C.

description:
ya know... for a city that doesn't have a lot of Fast Food spots... SF still finds a way to do Fast Food the legit, non/franchised way. 

Double Decker definitely fills in that void, in a good way. It's very reasonably priced, pretty simple burgers and wings menu, and comes out quick... not to mention they use nothing but fresh ingredients. The lettuce on my burgers have always had the crunch i'm looking for. 

Who would've thought Chips would go so well with Burgers and wings, and they've made on site too. lightly salted and fried to perfection. On tap beer, Happy hour on the Buffalo Wings, they've got tasty, simple and quick down perfectly.  

It's a very small place, and the upstairs area kinda gives it a cozy feel when you have an assortment of people in there. 

The only gripe i'd give to this place is the service can be sketchy now and then. Some days they're awesome at the register, other days it just feels like the person at the reg doesn't even wanna be there. 

This place has become a regular hangout for friends and i. Comfort food, cheap, and the food will get the job done.
author: Dez K.

description:
This spot pisses me off. Every time they throw something on the grill I can smell it coming in my window. So I head down there to straighten this mess out and two hours later after 10 hefeweizens, 24 wings, a order of fresh homemade potato chips and two sides of mayo I stumble home to pass out, forgetting to reprimand them. 

For a while these guys had 50% off at happy hour which resulted in retarded low deals.  I mean a dollar fifty for a pint of hef?!  Are you fekking kiddin?!  12 wings for like 2.50! Obviously they had to change the deal a bit to avoid bankruptcy but they still take 25% between 3 and 6.  Whenever I am feeling low or down and way too tired to go to the gym, this is where I head to cheer my fat ass up.
author: Dru P.

description:
I can't believe I'm saying this but this is exactly what the HV needed! While I still miss the adorable Zoya, Double Decker is an eatery for the common man.

You order at the counter and come away with a fat and juicy burger, fresh toppings and a side of fries that will leave you satisfied and satiated. It's called Double Decker I reckon for the two floors you can sit on, but what do I know?

So I love a good burger as much as the next Zambia born Sri Lankan U.S. citizen, but what I absolutely cannot wait to return to DD for is their all-you-can-eat Wing Wednesday. Lipitor be damned, I'm hittin' it!
author: Nish N.

description: Lots of fizz about this place. Not bad. Not the gourmet burger fix. But the hot chips are a sensation.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Allllright boys, get out your thank you cards and start writing because you will be sending me lots of thank yous and love after reading what I have to say.

Say you meet a girl and oh what a fine girl she is! You like her, I mean you are seeing your future (or at least a week) together and are just totally into it (you'd do her). Soon that fateful day comes when you actually get to spend an evening with her. She's said YES! to your date request and is all ready to spend some quality time with you and you are super stoked. But now the question is...where do you take her? 

Do you try and wine and dine her at Absinthe? Do you attempt to dazzle her drunkardly senses at Bourbon & Branch? Do you order the finest steak known to man at Epic? Hell no! You take that broad to Double Decker and find out if she's the real deal or not.

Reality is this. Many girls have the notorious reputations of being "high maintenance." Hell, even my Dad has accused me of this from time to time after listening to me snoot on about wine tastes, but a real woman (self included) will be just as happy with a bucket of hot wings and a Heffevizen as she will be with a fine bottle of wine and a juicy steak. 'Tis the truth boys, so why not save yourself the wallet drainage and take her here!

Now you may be thinking, "But Stephy, it's in a Days Inn for Christ's sake, and that might make her think that I have other things in mind" (hellooo, talk about bonus if she goes for that too, amigo!), but once she sees that you are taking her to not a one, but a two story restaurant with a view, c'mon, she'd be an idiot not to fall in love (or bed) with you. As a super duper bonus, Wednesdays offer all-you-can-eat hot wings for $11.99 from 6-8pm! Can you say win win!!! I can :)

Reality is this. Most women (and just about EVERY woman I know) like to eat. And if she doesn't, then you probably have a chick with issues on your hands. So take her out, feed her and don't go over the top too soon. You will only be setting expectations and who needs that. It's about the time spent together and nothing adds a happy bonus to that like a bucket of wings.

Just sayin'

Oh and they deliver, but you don't get the killer second floor view of the parking lot and Grove if ya do that ;)
author: Stephy S.

description: the wings were delicious. it was a lot smaller than i thought it was going to be.
author: Ayana K.

description:
I hear that Wednesday is all you can eat Wing night!  Sadly, I wasn't there on a Wednesday, so I can't review the wings.

I did have the signature Double Decker, but was disappointed.  I've had much better elsewhere.  The burger was big and greasy as expected, but for some reason, it just didn't do it for me.  Maybe it was just TOO big??  What drew me into this place was the fresh cut and cooked potato chips!  You don't see that every day.  The other fried potato options were just OK too.

Service was pretty much non existent, as we had to ask the guy to get off his laptop long enough to make the shake we had ordered.  Odd setup at the base of a hotel, you can easily miss it.  You basically order your food, and sit in the semi circle restaurant and wait for your order.  Seating is limited.

All in all, I wish I went elsewhere.
author: Michael M.

description:
I wanted to love this place.  A burgers and hot wings place attached to the Days Inn in Hayes Valley, where you place your order for various artery-clogging cravings downstairs and go upstairs to find a table in the little room with 240 degrees of windows?

But I must say, they could have done a few things righter to win that 4 or even 5 star review in my book.  

1. We got our Caesar salad in a plastic takeout box with a little plastic container of out-of-the-bottle watery dressing.  Maybe just maybe we shouldn't have expected a good salad from a burgers and hot wings joint, but I could have used a real plate.  And creamier dressing.  And a few shavings of parmesan.

2. Silverware.  Even at diners we get to eat with real silverware, instead of plastic forks.  

3. Something aside from KOIT over the speakers.  I mean, sometimes I do want to eat hot wings to Love Songs with Delilah.  But most of the time, I don't.

4. Too much sauce on them wings.  A smidgeon less will do, and get them a little more crispy in the deep fryer. 

Still, I will likely be back.  The burgers looked pretty tasty.  And you betcha I will be ordering a bucket of 50 hot wings at some point for delivery for some random party.  Did I mention they deliver?
author: Audrey T.

description:
We were all talking about wings the other day, and someone mentioned Double Decker.  So, naturally, I had to go on over and check them out.

Doubler Decker replaced Zoya's and takes over that very funny space in the Days Inn.  The service is pretty basic at DD -- order downstairs, walk outside and up the stairs and hang out in the dining room.  The nice folks who work at DD will bring you your food when it is ready.  

Since this was my first time I ordered a small batch of inferno wings, and a basic burger & fries.  The Burger and Fries were decent.  DD's burger patty is a pretty basic neiman beef patty.  The fixings on the burger were basic: lettuce, tomato, onion.  The patty felt a bit dwarfed by the bun and fixings.  The fries were okay too -- even a little bit crunchy, which I like.

Something was a bit amok with their ketchup -- perhaps it is hunt's intead of heinz?  Putting it on my fries I had one of those "this is not the usual ketchup moments."  I actually started dipping my fries in the wing dressing...

And speaking of the wings -- I ordered them "inferno" style.  Now, I am *not* the person to ask about levels of spiciness.  My brother says when people ask me that sort of question there should be a sign under my face that says: "Professional Driver.  Closed Course.  Do Not Attempt."  So, when I say that the wings were pleasantly spicy, you can calibrate that remark for yourself. ;-)  

The wings are your basic traditional buffalo-style preparation.  Butter & Crystal sauce.  I believe that the "inferno" variation adds several shakes of cayanne pepper to the mix.  This makes for a nice spicy-on- the-tongue-as-well-as-the-back-of-the-throat feeling.  The wings come with celery and nice thick blue cheese dressing for dipping.  

If you need plenty of wings to make you happy, they have all you can eat wing nite on Wednesday.  

I'm glad there's another option for a tasty inexpensive lunch in Hayes Valley.
author: Stephan W.

description:
I went here for lunch today because Allison T. said this place was great.  I think I need to stop listening to her.(how do you remove friends from your profile?..........j/k ally)  We got here around 1245 and we were the only ones here.  Left like around 115 and nobody else were around.

This is what we had:

California Burger
Double Decker burger
Regular burger
Garlic fries
Buffalo wings(hot)
Orangina
Iced Tea

$41.00

The buns they used for the burger is not proportional to the patty.  They probably need a 1/4 to 1/2 pound patty to make this work.  Remember that old Wendy's commercial back in the day with that old lady saying........."Where's the Beef?" I think she might be describing this place.

They mixed in chopped garlic/onions into their patties which is very unique.  At least I hope it was chopped garlic and onions. hahhahahah

The chicken wings are very small.  Not worth getting messy for such a small piece. The taste is there, but for me.............I need a chicken wing that is bigger than my pinkie. 
Garlic fries were old.  They probably need to change the oil or make these fries made to order.  It looked and tasted old.
The person taking our order was very nice and the service was quick but overall it's not worth coming back.
