They need to make these changes for this place to be good. There are a lot of other restaurants in this neighborhood that is much better.
author: jason g.

description:
Don't you hate when you go to a 'gourmet burger' place and you can't eat the burger with your hands?  This is not a problem here. 

The double decker burger here was the BEST burger I have had in the city.  It's the perfect 'big burger' - the largest size you can actually pick up and eat with your hands.   Not trying to be some sort of fancy gourmet dish, just perfectly cooked and seriously tasty.  

Do not be put off going here by the weird location at the Days Inn hotel or the fact it looks sketchy.  Just try it.  

Excellent garlic fries and Pyramid Hefeweizen round off the experience for the perfect 5* burger joint.
author: George S.

description: i'm kinda loving this place. The burgers are made right there on the spot! the lettuce and vegetables are fresh and the workers are pretty chill. Me and my dad go here pretty often just to have burgers or buffalo wings with a few glasses of beer. The place is tiny, but I find it makes the place cozy~ They always play sports on the tv which I actually really like (given the fact that I rarely watch sports on my own accord). The price is decent and it beats having to go to a fast food chain.
author: Hannah K.

description:
UPDATE!
Double Decker got back to me and straightened out the delivery issue I had so Double Decker and I are a hot item again. Back to going steady!
Think I will pop in tomorrow for some extra hot wings and a couple ice cold drafts....
author: Terry M.

description:
Double Decker rocks!!  The burgers are priced well, they use good quality products.  They have wings that knock the socks out of most of the wings I have experienced in San Francisco.  The home made chips are fantastic and not greasy at all.  

If you live locally its my advice to go in chill out and grab some drinks(they are well priced and there is usually sports on both TVs), but the delivery is also really quick!!! Cheers to the DD.
author: Don I.

description:
Okay so their slogan or tag line says it perfectly: 
"A place for GREAT burgers and buffalo wings!" 

Couldn't agree more. I've had both burgers & wings, and they are both excellent! 

Price is good; fairly inexpensive. 
Service is friendly and efficient. 
I will definitely be returning in the future.

BONUS: All the burgers are Niman Ranch (happy cows)! :)
author: Sandy M.

description:
Double Decker has the best potato chips West of Pennsylvania!  They are thin and crisp and fresh from the fryer.  If you love East Coast style chips it's worth it to stop in just for this menu item.  The Western Burger is excellent as are the Wings.  Salads are so so and the Chinese Chicken Salad was bad. 

I live very close and prefer delivery since chez moi has a better view.  Overall the service is fast and tongue friendly, always hot and fresh.  If you decide to dine there, beware of a lack of ambiance, bad lighting, plastic utensils catsup packets etc. So don't set your expectations too high if you decide to eat there.  However, it's clean and the people are nice.  Also perfect if you are staying at the Days Inn. it's a great place to eat under $10.  Remember if at all possible go w/delivery or togo if you are expecting a `nice' burger place.

Oh yes, and one more time, don't forget the potato chips!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: emily b.

description: Great hot wings, even better if you can make it there during Happy Hour, because then they're dirt cheap AND delicious.
author: Crystal T.

description:
OMG..WINGS!! Yum. Fries, burgers AND Beer! What more could you want? The food is sooo sooo good and the prices are great and happy hour???!!  The hot sauce was too hot for me! That almost never happens btw...
This is a really great place and I highly recommend it!

My only complaint is that there isn't one in the EB!!! :( boo!
author: .Vanessa G.

description:
I love this place. Came here this past Sunday. It's real easy to find. Parking (uum I just parked in the Days Inn). It's literally connected. The place is real small. We all had burgers.

I had the California Burger. The bread is fresh. It's soft and taste just right. I like the condiments. Not slathered in mustard,mayo or ketchup. It's just right. My sis had the Western Burger and loved it. We also heard a few people come in and order that too. My man had the regular burger too. They filled us and we got a side of large fries. It was enough for the three of us. I thought it wouldn't be. Those were delicious too. I'm not the biggest fan of fried but they were good in my book. 

The service was great. The guy at the counter is real friendly, patient and let's you decide what to order even if you take a thousand years. 

I can't wait to come again. Oh and I did see a sign that said they DELIVER! So plus points. I really wanna try the wings. I'll be back soon. =)
author: Sarina I.

description:
Bottomless chicken wings on Wednesdays. That's the draw. I can barely finish up 2 handfuls. Depending on your group's appetites, you may just order a certain number of wings for pricing strategy. 

Overall the food is tasty because they like to slather the sauce. When I mean slather, I mean dripping teriyaki BBQ sauce from the Hawaiian burger or buffalo sauce soup with wings.
author: Cathy H.

description: Went last night for the first time & their burger was okay. Not a big fan. & their Garlic fries had a lot of garlic. Looks like they have a cheap happy hour though.
author: Jade D.

description: My co workers and I order almost once a week. I love everything on the menu. The burgers are very good.  We've always had good service when ordering delivery. Except this last time was a nightmare. I was shocked by the poor customer service. We had 5 orders burgers, fries and milkshakes.  Placed the order through GrubHub as usual. Not only was the order late by 20 mins.   Half the order was missing including shakes. GrubHub was great they called DD.  Grubhub was told they had no drivers. No one would return to bring the rest of the order. Grubhub apologized and refunded half the order. They also gave us free Grubhub money for later use.   So how do you not have a delivery person? Your only 4 blocks from where you have to deliver. The delivery man just left here! So this tell me you only made half the order.   Otherwise the rest would've been sitting there waiting for delivery. No worries because I'm not f*****g with your restaurant again!
author: Sandy P.

description:
I guess maybe I should have had wings instead of a burger, since that's what people seem so excited about, but I didn't. I had the California Burger, with swiss cheese and avocado. 

Complaint #1: The whole burger tasted so much like nothing that I actually had to open it up and check if there were any condiments in place, much less the ones I had ordered. It was all there, just somehow magically rendered completely bland. 

Complaint #2: The guy who took my order didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked. I didn't realize it until I was eating and the thing was cooked a bit beyond where I like it. I guess I could have volunteered the information if I'd thought of it, but I think it's standard for the order-taker to ask about that kind of thing.

Complaint #3: I'm getting tired of burger places where the food seems reasonably priced until you realize that the fries are going to be an extra 2 bucks. Come on! That should be included!

In conclusion, in the neighborhood, I'd rather go to Flippers, and if I don't mind traveling, I'd rather go to Pearl's or Burgermeister or tons of other places.
author: Julia G.

description:
Burgers delivered to my door - YAY!! It's about time San Francisco! I've grown tired of our current repertoire: asian, pizza, or cheesesteak, and Double Decker delivered for free within their ETA of 30-45 minutes.

For dinner, we ordered an original hamburger w/ american cheese, a western burger, some buffalo wings, and macaroni salad (yes, we're weird). I wasn't crazy about the wings, but B liked them a lot...said they reminded him of the five cent wings he ate back in the day. Something like that. I've personally had better wings at many different places, but then again, those couldn't be eaten in the comfort of my own home. In any case, we both enjoyed our burgers and agree that we'd be ordering from Double Decker again fo sho (I'm dying to have a strawberry milkshake delivered to me doorstep).

We also agreed, however, that we'd only step foot in Double Decker if we happened to be in the neighborhood and were craving burger food. It's not quite worth a special trip.

Four stars for a decent burger and free delivery.
author: Lisa C.

description:
The best burger in Hayes Velley; the worst music in the world. Almost 5 stars, and the garlic fries are excellent, too... but just so you know, there IS a camera on the second floor in case you and the other patrons are conspiring to mute KOIT. "Lite Rawk, Less Talk!" Kee-rhist. That's a 1-starrer. I comprimise on account of the fact that I understand some people might like hearing the early nineties hit "Beauty and the Beast" by Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson while trying to digest. 

Eat good burger plug ear-holes.
author: Orin Z.

description:
The wings are nothing amazing--they're tiny and the Hot sauce hardly stings. Still, they are pretty much what you expect when craving wings and for that reason, along with the price, I deem it at least a 3 star. Sure, the place looks a bit shady and the variety of other items are short of even average, but the wings plus crispy fries (my kind of fries!) equate to a blissful hot wings memory, reminiscent of college days gorging on unhealthy bar food to fuel late night studies.
Beware though; although the wings lack a painful bite during consumption, your stomach will be paying the price for a full basket a good hour later. 
I would come again, but maybe coat my stomach a bit better with blue cheese sauce, milk, antacids, anything!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Imagine waking up each morning and dozing off each night in your hotel with the intoxicating smell of buffalo wing grease. Sounds a bit like heaven doesn't it? Well, like Belinda Carlisle once sang, "Heaven is a place on Earth". Wait Dave, what's this hotel stuff? I thought Double Decker was a restaurant? That's right, you are correct. It is a restaurant AND it's attached to the Day's Inn. The two worlds of gourmet bar-food and budget-travel comfort collide for all those lucky tourists.

OK, so on to the food. Wednesday night is all-you-can-eat wing night for $11.95. You can't beat that! Beer drafts are pretty reasonable too at $3 a pint. I had to stick with the "hot" wings, because after one "inferno" wing I wanted to cut out my tongue and stomp on it to put out the fire! Even though the wings were not the best I've had (they are a little small), overall they are very good, crispy and tasty! In this case, who cares about wing size when it's all you can eat, right?!

The place is very clean, which was a pleasant surprise. The staff there is very friendly and is always trying to help you eat your money's worth by offering up more baskets of wings. Check out the waving cat behind the counter. His paw continually wants to stuff more wings down your throat. I love that cat.

After all your gluteny, take some psyllium husk (http://www.healthcastle.com/psyllium-cholesterol.shtml) and you'll be good as new for next Wednesday!!
author: Dave L.

description:
Sad to see that Zoya has left the premises. . . but Double Decker seems more appropriate for the location. . . connected to the Days Inn.  Tried out their burger and wings on Sunday afternoon. . . very decent for quick eat.  Not too many affordable joints in Hayes Valley, so this is a welcome sight, unless you're watching your weight.  The wings are east coast-style (this may be somewhat fictional: lived in CT for a while and went to this place calls TK's and these taste very similar).  Nice owners and I hope they do well. . . their burger tastes better than Flipper's in quality of beef but critiquing a burger can be so subjective!

I wonder if Double Decker means: the bus that represents their logo, the two slabs of beef, the two stories of their structure, or the awful double-decker freeway that used to inhabit Octavia Street?
author: E L.

description: You can catch me here almost once a week for happy hour with my bf and his uncle. $2 Blue Moons, $1 garlic fries, potatoe chips, and onion rings, along with the wings..can't ask for a better deal! Burgers are also very well made. I was impressed by the freshness of my lettuce. Service is very friendly and they have TVs!
author: Tyra S.

description:
A friend and I had the brilliant idea of kicking off a Saturday with wings and beer.  We got to Double Decker around 1:30 and there was only one other person there.  We ordered 2 dozen wings, some chips, and a pitcher of beer.

The wings were solid; we've both had better, but these were great wings.  They could have used more sauce, maybe next time I'll ask for extra, but we both walked away satisfied.  

The dudes working here were friendly, and there's a decent amount of space between the two levels (it's called double decker for a reason) and a few sidewalk tables.

I'm pretty sure I'll be back, hopefully next time for happy hour.
author: Joseph N.

description:
The Good: $13 Unlimited Wings from 4-8pm on Wednesdays
The Bad: Your Tummy 12 hours Later

So with a name like Double Decker my friend and I expected some sort of fish and chips English style type pub.  What we got was a cramp two story motel rest. add on.  Prob fit 15 people max. Despite the small dingy place though the food was solid. 

Your best deal is the unlimited wings if you can handle it.  They come in basket of a dozen  mix wings and drumsticks of various sizes.  Cook well but dreeeench with the sauces.  I like the mild as the hot has a kick to it (well for my weak tongue). 

Going in we were like yeah we'll have at least 4 baskets each - what we barely managed to finish was half that.  Somehow the Asians next to us put us to shame with there 6 basket each! - how do they do it?

The chips and the onion rings were good and the burgers looked juicy even though we didn't try it.  Of course it wouldn't be complete without a pitcher of nice cold beer to help it all go down.

Food: 3.5 Stars
Location: 4 Stars
Service: 4 Stars
Place:2 Stars
Overall: 3.5 Stars
author: Manohak S.

description:
I guess my thought process here was that a place that looks like this must have some killer food! It seemed to be very recommended by fellow yelpers.  

The fries were decent, but my chicken sandwich was beaten to a 1/4 inch and was the driest meat I have ever tasted.  Add on no flavor and a small generic bun- a big letdown.

Yes, everyone there was nice and they even got me a glass of ice, but I would have settled for good food only.
author: jennifer j.

description:
After my last non-homemade burger experience, at Joe's Cable Car (two stars) I was pretty hesitant about ever bothering to pay for someone else to make me a burger ever again. But I was out and about, hungry, and wanted some nice red meat, and the boyfriend recommended this place.

To get them out of the way, the negatives: Double Decker is attached to a Day's Inn. Literally. Yet the parking is for HOTEL GUESTS ONLY. Fuck you, Day's Inn. And when I went in there they had a basketball game turned up super loud on the TV. I guess some people'd like that, but I freakin' hate sports. And loud TVs in restaurants.

BUT HOLY CHRIST, THAT WAS THE TASTIEST BURGER I'VE EVER HAD. I am so not kidding you. I was totally blown away. Totally worth the money. I got a barbeque bacon cheeseburger and the bacon was perfectly cooked (not too chewy, not too crispy) and there was exactly the right amount of sauce on it, so that I could still taste it but it wasn't dripping on my nice clothes. The fries were super yummy, and the chocolate shake (which was more like a shake/freeze hybrid--if you don't like to be aware there's ice in your shake, you might not like theirs) really hit the spot. The guys that work there are really friendly too.

I'll totally be back for more take-out, but I don't really plan on ever eating inside.
author: Lynae Z.

description:
The burgers are better than the wings, but, all-in-all, not a bad place for a quick bite to eat.  I had a western burger, a small order of fries, and a Sierra Nevada for $10 (Happy Hour pricing).  I left very satisfied.

The location (part of the Days Inn complex in Hayes Valley) is odd, bordering on kitsch (fake grass carpeting the stairs to the dining room and bathroom on the upper floor).
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Very good hamburger. Inferno wings are dam hot. Great onion rings.
author: Ryan B.

description:
March Madness turned to April Sadness, no only did I lose in my pool I lost another personal bet,  stakes being dinner at Double Decker, for Weds Wing night. Do I eat wings?  Not so much...  But this wasn't my prize, if I won I was going to Arby's. 

April Sadness however turned to April Satisfaction, yes I paid the $20 something dollar bill but very much enjoyed sitting downstairs (upstairs was full!), watching all the business activity as well as the Celtics game and eating my Cali chicken sandwich. The owner and staff were very attentive, the wings were flowing , the inferno was too hot for my hot date, it was quite the show watching him cope with the inferno heat, so you might just stick w/ the 'hot'.  The beers are very reasonably priced, a little over $3 for a pint.  The kitchen is small but they crank out lots of good stuff!  Happy hour deals look great M-F, 3-6pm ,  1/2 price beers and sides and some wing deals.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I give this pace 4stars cos I went there for spicy wings.  Obviously I ordered the inferno wings to satisfy the craving, and got what I bargained for :D

The guy I place the order with did come back after the order was placed to pass on the warning from the kitchen, but that was'nt gonna get in the way of what I was there for.

If SPICY is what you want, Double Decker has a solution for you (trust me)!
author: Vivek N.

description: Fresh burgers in a small shop just off the main strip at Hayes.
author: Eric N.

description: This place sucks. Honestly don't even try their pizza because it's awful and their attitudes are even worse. Clearly the customer is never right and they do not value customer service. I would never recommend eating here.
author: Lauren B.

description: Burgers and wings are awesome here.  I love spice and the wings have some major kick to them.  I usually get "hot" when ordering wings but at DD I get "mild" and are still full of spice.  The bacon cheese burger is excellent.  They have some great HH specials are well as all you can eat wings on Wednesday nights.  The fries are also really really good and so are the shakes, they use Mitchell ice cream!!!
author: Jessica B.

description: Went with a co-worker, and he said it was one of the best hot wings he's had.  I went with mild and he went with hot...said he could even go with infierno!
author: C L.

description:
REALLY REALLY good!

They turn out high quality burgers for an incredible deal... also their shakes are super thick.

Can't wait to try their hot wings. 

Definitely recommended.
author: Nenette Y.

description: I've only had their wings and they are good.  They offer 3 levels on the hot sauce - reg, mild and hot...It comes with celery sticks and blue cheese.  The place itself is pretty small so I've always done take out.   Whenever I'm craving hot wings which aren't too overpriced - I come here.
author: glen o.

description:
Holy crap!  Burger delivery??  I am *all* over that.

Turns out there's a reason most burger joints don't deliver:  Burgers don't deliver well.  Both the burger and the fries cool quickly, so even fast delivery doesn't get them to you before they're cold.  Mine were delivered in less than the promised 30 minutes, but yeah... they were cold.

However, I can tell that this would have been a great burger and fries, had I actually left the house and gone to the restaurent.  So either get your burgers in person, or know that when you absolutely must have burgers delivered, they just won't be all that a burger should be.
author: Laurel G.

description:
All you can eat wings Wednesday's 5-8pm for $11.95.

Does that sound like something you might be interested in? ( Sorry couldn't resist that line from Entourage)

No atmosphere here but some great wings and a great burger and fries. Double Decker (there are 2 floors) serves salads, burgers, wings, milkshakes and some various sides like potato/mac salad.

I will definitely come back here for any and all of the above.
author: Jen S.

description:
I would have originally given this place 4 stars because the food was decent and the price was not bad, but... they lied to me! I asked them while I was waiting for my order about their delivery service.  The apt was only in SOMA, not too far away and they said sure they would deliver.  That was not true when I called again, they didn't have their minds straight!

For full review and pics go to http://www.kats9lives.com/2008/05/i-want-chicken-tonight-thats-chicken.html

This place is run by Asians.  It looks pretty clean and I haven't checked out their dining area.  It's connected to a small motel, kind of dinky.  Every time we came, we picked it up to take home.  At first I wanted to try their all you can eat specials on Weds, but after checking out that their dining space would be limited and on the second floor... I opted out.

Besides, you have to travel up and down stairs to get more?  I bet you would have to wait until they were made too... too much hassle.  They have half off specials which make the deal sweeter.  The wings they are use are only so-so size.  After being up in SF for so long, I really wanted to have some nice buffalo wings.  I was glad to have found this place, but after the annoying phone call I don't think I will be back.  The Garlic Fries were a bit disappointing as well.  They smelled so garlicky but had no flavor and were quite limp... blech.

If you do get food from here, be sure to take it home so you can enjoy and relax at home! ^_^
author: Kat L.

description:
Honestly, one of the worst burger/fries/shake meals I've had in a long time. If a restaurant is called "Double Decker," shouldn't burgers with 2 patties feature prominently on the menu? They don't. I get that the restaurant is two stories, but still...

As for the food, they use good quality meat, but somehow, it ended up not really tasting like anything once it became a burger. My friend and I decided that it tasted like a way-too-pricey In-N-Out clone - OK for $3, not so much for $7 or $8. The fries were ok, but the shake I had was one of the all-time-worst - it had no strawberry flavor, and worst of all, it was icy, not smooth. 

The two guys working there seemed pretty nice, and I wish I was able to give a better review. Sadly, overall it was one of those meals where I wish I hadn't blown my calorie budget!
author: Joshua Z.

description:
3 stars ONLY because they deliver!

I wasn't all that impressed with Double Decker.  The BF and I had come home from a weekend of hiking and were craving hamburgers.  We had Double Decker's menu posted on our refrigerator and gave them a call.  We had ordered the spinach salad, BBQ burger and buffalo wings.  

The salad was quite tasty and rather large (we split it).  The burger I'm sorry to say was mediocre.  It reminded me of a frozen patty that was bought at Costco...I will say, although their menu states that they cook burgers only to medium rare, I did notice on the receipt that it said extra medium rare...so that was good!  Other than that, the burger has your regular KC Masterpiece drizzled on it (we split that too).  The wings were ok.  Again, it was just the same old wing you could find any here else (again, we shared those too).

Like I said, 3 stars for delivery...that's pretty awesome!
author: Shane P.

description: Dinky sized wings. Tasty and filling. But these are the smallest wings I have ever seen. Hots are hot. Garlic fries are ok. Serviceable drunk food but there are better options. Friendly staff.
author: Dave N.

description: Best wings I've tasted in a long time and great prices too! Nice beer selection and VERY nice staff. The group I went with were never without beers, refills on wings and bowls of dressing. Kind of a weird set up, but if you aren't a prude, I think it really works! Check it out.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Dude...this place is good!

You know those days where the sun is shining, the birds are chirping, and all you wanna do for lunch is share a fuckin' great cheeseburger and some fuckin' great fries with your baby? 

Well, today was one of those days. 

And Double Decker? Totally came through.

We parked on the street. Ordered the California Burger and the Original Cheese...paired those with a large order of fries...and ten minutes later...we were in heaven. We sat upstairs, watched the Torch Procession craziness on the flat screen in the corner...and laughed about how glad we were that we decided NOT to head down to the Embarcadero, instead choosing to spend our afternoon eatin' great food in a little two-story burger joint overlooking Hayes Valley.

It's only been 9 hours since lunch and I'm already itchin' to go back.
author: Kate P.

description:
Double Decker is my hero.  (Sigh)

The proverbial Sunday morning reality check just got a whole lot better.  

You know the score:  Last night you got so caught up in your drinking activities that you *somehow* managed to forget to eat dinner and woke up with your worst hangover ever #752.  You can't even sit up, let alone make your way to some grease to remedy the situation.  The worst hangover ever is getting even worse by the minute...

Double Decker to the rescue!

Sunday morning delivery of burgers and fries is a beautiful thing.  They have earned the key to my city.
author: Marie S.

description:
Double Decker has dramatically improved!  Everything has tasted A LOT better.  I was very impressed. 

I usually choose Flipper's over this place because there's more variety, their burgers are cheesier, and they include a side salad with their burger meal.  

But I think Double Decker has finally won me over. Their ranch sauce was thick and creamy. I loooooooove ranch sauce so this makes a huge difference. Flipper's is like water. 

If you want a no fuss burger, friendly service, and somewhere to watch sports, go here. 

If you want different types of burgers, slow and unfriendly service go to Flippers.
author: Dorothy N.

description: Went on a chicken run and figured we'd stop by this place to see how great their buffalo wings were.  The one thing they definitely did right was their prices.  Unfortunately, their chicken wings are not that special or very tasty.  Their Inferno sauce is definitely hot as hell, but all it's good for is to mask the quality of their chicken and how they cook it.  The milder sauces and the blue cheese ranch sauce aren't as special.   The people there are friendly, but don't expect restaurant service.  It's definitely a take-out/delivery type of place.
author: B F.

description:
First off, the inferno wings are hot.  Very hot.  I'm a buffalo wing junkie, having eaten some severely spicy wings all over the country, and these almost did me in.  It's a deceptive heat -- the first bite seems fine, a few minutes later you're in the hurt locker.  I ate a dozen, requiring two beers, a few glasses of water, and several dozen napkins.  One of the staff seemed genuinely surprised I had eaten all of them, then the chef came up to check on me.  That's always a good sign.

The hot wings, by comparison, were very good and could be eaten without severe discomfort.  The potato chips were very good, fried and salted just right.  I didn't have a burger, but my friends report they were good (but not great).

Overall, great wings and great value.  Super friendly staff.  Half-price happy hours and all you can eat wing Wednesdays (4 PM - 8 PM) seal the deal.
author: James B.

description:
Hunger strikes while shopping... Somehow I've never noticed this place until yesterday. I liked how they utilized a small space. Ordered the western burger and made sure they knew that I wanted the burger to be done medium rare. They tell us that's the only way they cook it. 

First bite -- brown. Second bite -- brown. Middle of the burger -- brown. What happened?! 

Fries were good, though.
author: j. k.

description: Double decker  makes the best burgers! they were around the corner from my apartment, which made it all too easy to call in an order. Also, enjoyed the garlic fries! made with fresh garlic. I like how the ingredients are extremely fresh and all of the orders I've placed here have always been perfect. Wish you guys were here in LB :(
author: Jade L.

description:
I hadn't seen or heard of any good wings in the city until I came here before a March Madness basketball game. The wings are pretty good although could use a little bit more meat. The flavor is spot on though and apparently the hotter the better. I've seen a guy in there sweating with three Sprite cans in front of him housing a basket of wings. 

The burgers are really good - I can't believe people opt for Flipper's around the corner over these patties. I've had a basic cheeseburger which was really tasty and cooked perfectly. The hawaiian was pretty good except I'm pretty sure the pineapple was canned and you could tell. The fries are boss. Period. They also have the coldest draft in town.
author: Lydia H.

description: Since it is National Hamburger Day, I felt I should give burgers another chance after last night's disappointment. I was a bit skeptical of this place in the old coffee shop of the Rodeway Inn (that's a whole other story!), but I am loving Double Decker right now - big, greasy burgers and fries brought right to the office. They warned it might take a while, but the order was all the way to Laurel Heights in about 20 minutes. Considering it had traveled across town, the sandwich was exceptionally good. I opted for the chips over the fries, but will probably go with the regular fries next time. Chips were good, just didn't match the decadence of the burger. Burger delivery -- awesome!
author: Robert M.

description:
Double decker is fine, not bad but not worth going out of your way for.  The garlic fries are garlicky all right - they put any red sauce Italian to shame for lack o garlic.  Too much of a good thing.  The burgers are pretty average.  The chicken wings are the standout item here.  Skip the burg, get some regular fries, wings, maybe a beer and you'll leave happy.  

They deliver, which is probably the best option.
author: Aaron T.

description:
This space didn't work with the high end foodie crowd, it just didn't get enough attention.  I loved Zoya's, the restaurant before Double Decker, but it was so hidden and quiet.  Not only does DoubleDecker market their restaurant well, with brighter lights, clean minimal spaces, and special deals, their food is 100 times better than Flipper's.  Everything felt clean and generous.  Toppings are basic, menu is basic, but it tastes GOOD.  I paid almost twice as much at Flipper's for a mediocre or crappy burger, lacking any toppings.   Check out Mark L's review below about Flipper's cockroaches!  Then read mine.  Ahhh but at Double Decker, I feel loved. 

I can't wait to come back for all you can eat buffalo wing wednesdays.  Are you kidding me?  This is amazing to me.  Plus they have happy hour beers.

Please support them, I hate seeing this space jinxed eternally for small biz owners.
author: Annster L.

description:
After reading other's yelp reviews, I had to give DD a try. I mean, affordable food in the theatre district?!?!  you mean i can afford dinner and a show?!?  sure, i'm game!

Here's what we got, cheese burger, cali burger, chips and 1/2 doz buffalo wings (mild, cuz i'm too chicken shit to get hot/inferno).

OMG!!! the chips, you MUST try the chips.  perfectly fried, none of that oily burnt crap you usually get at other places.  these are crisp, extrememly crunchy, potato-y goodness.  its a great vehicle to sop up all that leftover buffalo wings sauce too.  yummers!!!

the burgers were both juicy and delicious.  The patty was cooked just the way I like it, it was moist and the beef was just so tender.  I mean seriously, if you've read my other posts, i usually don't give such praise unless it was *that* good.  and it was, cuz all that was left was a few pieces of paper lining, the bf even licked off the rest of the wings sauce. damn, for the low low price of $6.95 in a neighborhood where just walking into all that gourmet-ness can clean out your wallet, its an incredible deal.  

I'll be back for happy hour with my friends and the half price Buffalo dozen.  Yeah, I'm a sucker for good cheap food...LOL  =)
author: Ames K.

description:
Great burgers and service.  Wasn't a fan of the wings or onion rings though.  Maybe I'll try fries next time...


I have to add another star.  Their service is just plain awesome.  Burger delivery at its best!
author: F K.

description: Writing this review right now is making my mouth salivate at the thought of getting my hands on a Double Decker burger aghhh!!!!!  So I used to work across the street and one day my boss was craving and raving about about this burger joint.  That's weird I thougt, I hadn't seen a burger place closeby.  So we walk about 100 yards to a motel and into a space that's probably the size of my parents' walk in closet.  But don't let the exterior fool you!  I ordered the original (niman ranch beef) with a side of fries that I shared.  The juicy-ness of the meat along with the crispy yet soft bun and fresh veggies made me wish I ordered the double!  The fries are really great as well and prices are very reasonable.  The epitome of a hole-in-the-wall restaurant!
author: Grace Y.

description:
YES! another lovely burger joint. and not only that, draft beer to boot! a very ubiquitous location yet, hmmm... who cares?! my burger was juicy and tasty (i got a double decker) and my friend's was similarly moist with a tinge of pink --- nice! our onion rings?! deliciously fresh and fried and crispy. i predict a return to try the buffalo style wings -- i think it was buffalo style. anyway, draft beers! not that great a selection but not your typical bud and bud light fare either so wheeeee! Oh, and can you say in-house hand ground Niman Ranch beef? mooooo!

update: 
on a whim, I went with a friend to check out DD's happy hour (half price sides, pints and dozen wings) and whooo-hooo! it was another delectably delightful experience. i mean, c'mon, a mere $1.48 + tax, tip for a pint of suds? whoa, nelly! and their garlic fries I'm happy to say are sprinkled with REAL CHOPPED GARLIC. all my friends know I've got a weakness for the pungent stinkin' rose so them fries won me over. so did my basket of inferno chicken wings that came with celery sticks and a deliciously chunky blue cheese dressing. good job double d! i'ma comin' back agin sometime soon-ish. yay!
author: ray e.

description:
You can't complain about a place that just wants to a few things right. I get so sick and tired of places trying to do EVERYTHING a la "Cheesecake Factory". This place focuses on a small menu a la "In N Out Burger". 

Their fries are cut from fresh potatoes every day. 

Their burgers are simple and delicious. 

They have beer on tap. 

The place is comfortable to hang out in. 

They have a few tables outside.

It's off the beaten path. 

I don't know if this place is worth going out of your way for, but if you are in Hayes Valley and have a hankering for a burger and are deciding between Flipper's "Gourmet Burger" or Arlequin's "Spiced Lamb Burger" give Double Decker a consider, too. It's nothing fancy, but that's what's so comforting.

Update: My friend said their wings are good BUT their salads are horrible. Why one would order a salad at a burger/wing place, I don't know, but now you know better!
author: Timothy P.

description:
This place totally effed me last night.  DO NOT TRUST THEIR DELIVERY.

I called in for a delivery at 8:20 pm and was warned that the wait time may be up to 2 hours.  Being the buffalo wing lover that I am, I decided this was an unfortunate but tolerable amount of time to wait for delicious wings and chips.

The order never came.  To make matters worse, they close at 9pm meaning there was no one to answer my calls when I tried to get a hold of someone to see if the order would ever arrive.  So I'm just sitting there like an idiot in my apartment watching Matlock re-runs and wondering if the delivery guy would come a knocking.  

Instead of chicken wings, I was forced to eat a delicious pint of Ben and Jerry's Americone Dream for dinner.  Which went well with the Matlock on tv.

I will not be ordering from them again.
author: dylan m.

description: Don't let the hole-in-the-wall feel throw you -- Double Decker rivals some of the best wing/burger joints in the city, and does it with a touch of class. Although the burgers are juicy and flavorful, the real deal at Double D is a meal made of the spicy buffalo wings and homemade potato chips. While in the tightly packed lower deck, order a double dozen of the mild, hot, or inferno wings with a basket of chips. Then take a seat in the secluded upper deck, which has a beautiful view of the Days Inn parking lot. You can't get classier than that.
author: Jeff H.

description: Decent place if  you're into the greasy burgers and french fries. The prices are decent and the quality is pretty good. Their second location on Market is conveniently located between the 3rd and 4th streets. I haven't yet tried their wings, salads, or milk shakes, which look delicious, btw.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Wings from the bosom of the creator from Buffalo!   How they broke into my dorm room circa 1991 in Upstate NY and stole the recipe for chicken wings from my misspent youth, I'll never know.  The fresh potato chips are good too.  Next time I'll get the burger.  This time I couldn't stop with the wings.  

As far as the space goes, it's pretty weird and tiny.  But did I mention the wings...
author: el r.

description:
I was impressed by the burger quality and the milkshakes, but I think that's due to the quality of the products: niman ranch natural beef and delicious mitchell's ice cream. otherwise, the salad was bitter and came as if we were eating it to go, complete with dressing and packet of "parmesan" we had to toss in ourselves in the plastic container. And what kind of a place serves quality beef but not cheddar cheese?  american chesse, no thanks!
i didn't try the wings, maybe they're great; but i know i won't be going back for a burger.
author: Tamsen S.

description:
tom and dot serve the wildest wings this side of the mississippi.  i only tried mild, being the wussy-shit i am.  next time i pop in, i'm gonna man up and get mine Inferno-style and i WILL go crazy cuz that's just the way it is.  if only you could see my face when the inferno sauce hits the tip of my tongue and sizzles on its way down my esophagus...

"it went down,down,down
and the flames went higher.
And it burns,burns,burns
the ring of fire
the ring of fire."

p.s. - the guys there are awesome cats
author: boola h.

description:
It's unfortunate for a business when their product quality isn't reflected in their service. 

While the food at double decker is quite good, their service is beyond poor.

We arrived at 8:20, well before their 9:00 pm closing time. We were informed upon ordering that we could only take our food to go. I realize that it's saturday night and you want to get out as quickly as possible, but there is no way we would linger beyond closing time.

Nonplussed, we ordered to go. I watched our food being prepared, noticing that there was little handwashing going on between answering phones, handling cash and preparing food.

Eventually our order was called. Since we watched the food being assembled we could easily see that there was no avocado going onto the california burger. Before leaving we checked the ingredients and LO! no avocado. The burger was brought to the counter. We told them that there is no avocado. He looked at the tag to see what was ordered, though less than a minute prior, he had announced "california burger," which has avocado and swiss. he made a surly face and sliced the avocado onto the patty.

While the food is great, subpar service makes me think twice about returning.
author: peter g.

description: I had a hard time giving Double Decker 4 stars, because it's not a 4-star restaurant. It is, however, a quick, cheap and delicious stop for burgers, wings, chips, and garlic fries. Go here when you're feeling spontaneous, and trust in the 4-stars. They are well deserved.
author: Brian F.

description:
i placed an on-line order for ($20 minimum) delivery:
potato salad 
wings
garlic fries 
house salad 

the delivery took approximately 45 minutes; pretty decent. i was surprised to find the wings were cold, and had been tossed into a thin paper bag that was soggy and tearing.  this could easily be remedied by wrapping them in foil instead. it would be inexpensive, and save the customers from seeing a dripping red bag that appears to be full of tampons. gross? yeah, that's what i thought.

the potato salad was flavorful, and seemed home-made. the house salad was standard, and the fries were cold (as to be expected), but well-seasoned.

the delivery driver stayed on his cell phone for the duration of the drop-off; a turn-off. overall this was a so-so experience.
author: Andy P.

description:
If you know me, you know that I love chicken wings.  Double Decker makes some mean chicken wings and their happy hour deal is awesome - 25% off dozen wings, sides and beer from 3-6, and mother of holy grail all-you-can-eat wings on Wednesdays.

Neiman burgers are good but I still love Burgermeister's more. Ordered delivery recently and it arrived in 15 minutes.  Sweet!

It's a strange location and it doesn't really have room to accommodate large parties.  Worth a trip if you are in the neighborhood -- which I always am.
author: Dee Dee N.

description: LOL, I find it hilarious that this is a burger place and I've never tasted the burgers, but the wings are the best I've had in the city.  Deliver is great, quick and the food is still hot.  BTW, did I say that the wings are THE BEST!!!
author: Jason B.

description:
Double Decker is good at what they do! Burgers are bomb, chips are delicious, and the fries are good.  I think their wings are decent, but could have more sauce and sometimes the wings are small.  

Great hangover food, especially when you don't want to leave the house.
author: T H.

description: This place is pretty dang good!! I ordered the california chicken burger (comes with swiss cheese and avocado) and large garlic fries. My friend that the chicken wings which I tried and were pretty good. I felt like they were a little too wet and there was a huge puddle of grease on the bottom of the basket but hey when is there not a big puddle of grease on the bottom of a basket of chicken wings. Also the wings were juicy and cooked well inside. A lot of times chicken wings have this greasy dried up stale taste.  Also my burger was cooked to perfect! and the fries were DELICIOUS!! they give you fresh tangy garlic.  The only complaint I can make is that I felt the prices were too much. I paid about $12 for a burger and my fries. I just don't think I would come back here since the prices are steep for what you get.
author: Em F.

description: This place is really good.  I just in moved down the street from this place and was really happy to discover how good it is.  The burger was amazing.  It was really juicy and flavorful.  We also tried the wings and garlic fries and were pleased with both. This place would be perfect if it was a little cheaper and it was open late night.  This would be perfect late night food.
author: Aaron L.

description: This place rules.  Went in there with my boy Jake after we got done filming BMX stunts.  We decided it was time to go for a burger, because burgers rule.  Jake loves hot wings and beer, and maybe a little bit of a game.  He told me we should try this spot.  I had high hopes, because I haven't found a really good burger spot near where I live.  The best burgers (to me) are at Rosamunde for Burger Tuesday.  But when it's not Tuesday, what are you supposed to do?  Well, me and Jake cruised into this place.  The location is rad.  It's hard to find because it looks like it's part of the hotel next to it.  This is awesome, because only locals hang out.  And because it's a sportsbar vibe, there weren't a ton of pretentious foodie SF types milling about.  So I felt real comfortable.  There was a TV showing the game.  My boy Jake was down to watch the game and drink a beer.  He ordered a beer and got some hot wings.  I ordered a double decker.  Now this burger reminds me of a fancy Double Double from In N Out, which is definitely a compliment.  The meat was high quality, the flavour was great, the food, ultimately satisfying.  It was like having a delicious burger brick in your stomach.  I drank a coke and watched the game for a minute.  The staff was hella chill and the clientele in the spot were just hanging out, I noticed.  No problem.  Jake asked me if I wanted to try a chicken wing.  Sure.  I grabbed that b*&$% and threw her into the masticator.  Chomp chomp and wow, epic spice explosion!  And I'm not referring to your first adult adventure involving five seconds and a poster for the erstwhile popular stars of the motion picture film, Spice World.  No, this was a flavorful wing, full of the hottest spice around.  The spiciness sneaks up on you.  It's hot at first, and gets more so as time goes on.  Amazing!  I wished it could never end.  This place goes hard.  Real talk.
author: Whitney D.

description: This is the place you want to go to after downing cheap booze at Jade's happy hour.  Even a veggie can find a decent burger.  I have only myself to blame for the garlic fries.  For I woke up with something even worse than a hangover, which I didn't have: an aura of garlic that permeated my being all morning.  Mea culpa . . .
author: Joe B.

description:
This place has good hamburger and wings.  But nothing to write home about.  Actually the best thing on the menu is the home made chips.  They make their own chips which means they arrive at your table hot!!  

Only go on a nice day they keep the doors open since the place is so small.  Which means if it is cold outside it is cold inside.

Service is OK not the fasted.
author: John D.

description:
Tried this place for the first time and fell in love!! The "mild" wings and potato chips there were Fantabulous!!!!  Awesomely friendly service. Clean and fresh restroom to wash my fingers:-). Will bring my family here next week. 

Great food, inexpensive, and very friendly service!!! Got my 5 stars!!
author: Loreen L.

description: They got bomb ass neiman ranch burgers, and they wings is good, they have a pretty hot sauce so if u can eat bout a dozen or too,  It's probably gonna go in hot then come out hot, so go get a milkshake or sum.
author: Mark H.

description:
3.5 stars.

we ordered some double decker for take out last night since they don't deliver to our north beach hood. that's okay. i had the california chicken burger and wings on the side. roomie had some amazing onion rings - those were fantastic! chicken sandwich was a little dry but that's okay. the avocado made up for it.

wings were good... i think they would've been perfection had they had a bit more sauce. once i got to the bottom and scraped the leftover sauce on to the remaining wings they got incredibly better. i'd go back but definitely eat in person.
author: laura f.

description:
I love this place. Its my hangover lunch special. There cheeseburger does the trick everytime and when i feel like overeating I splurge on the french fries.  If im lucky they  come with those extra super-cruncy-greasy-xs-doubleYUM-a littleBitOvercooked  fries that I always wish there were more of. 
As for the staff- they're AWESome. 

The burgers are simply delicious and cure any IN N OUT craving  i might have.
author: SF Blondie B.

description: Checked this place out with a few buddies last night for the Wednesday $12.99 all-you-can-eat wing deal.  The place is TINY, but the sidewalk seating outside is pretty nice when the weather permits.  The wings were a bit on the small side, but were cooked well and had nice flavor.  My only complaint would be the "inferno" wings aren't hot at all.  They taste good, but the heat just isn't there.   I guess they're just trying to cater to the overly sensitive palates here in SF, but what's the point of having an inferno option if it's not going to actually be hot?  Anyway, I'm sure we'll be coming back as it was a pretty good experience all around.  Not bad for a tiny wing joint connected to a Days Inn motel.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Wings are good. Burgers are good. Milkshakes? I wouldn't know because you wouldn't make me one, you rat bastards.

A group of us went to Double Decker for SF Burger Off. It was a Sunday, so maybe they weren't expecting a large-ish group of people to suddenly appear out of thin air, but if it's on your menu, and I order it, I want you to make it. They apparently use Mitchell's Ice Cream, the best ice cream in the city despite what you hipsters might say, so I was immediately interested. I ordered, and was simply told "no." I got a beer instead.

I made sure to take a poop in the toilet and not flush. Take that!
author: Alexis C.

description: The best cheese burger, onion rings, and vanilla shake I've EVER HAD. Seriously. I love this place. Not only that, the people who cook up the burgers there are so nice and awesome too, and that just makes everything so much better :). You gotta go here, and have yourself the best burger ever. Trust me! All I can say: TOTALLY WORTH ALL THE CALORIES.
author: Sabina And Pete V.

description:
We order delivery from them through grubhub.  They always deliver fast (15 minutes or less), and we're about 10 blocks away.  The burgers are good.  I *love* the wings.  And my husband swears by their onion rings.  

I went inside once to pick up a take-out order.  I didn't seem that inviting but delivery is great!
author: Tim H.

description: Great burgers and nice people. Went to Double Decker before going to Davies Symphony Hall. It was perfect because it a couple blocks away and we were able to grab a quick bite.
author: amy y.

description:
If I could give them less stars, I would.
Suffice it to say, that I am unable to rate their food.  If it had ever arrived, I would have more to say.  But this business was horribly unprofessional.  After telling me that they would deliver my order in under an hour, when I called at 1.5 hours the guy answering the phone just said "I don't know where my driver is".  Full stop.  Nothing else to say.  After many minutes of asking questions to understand what was going on, I deciphered that he hasnt seen his driver for a while and my food hasn't been cooked yet.  He then made things worse by promising "he will be there in 10-15 minutes", which is clearly another promise that they couldn't deliver.  Pun intended.  Repeat patronage is not.
author: Eugenie F.

description:
I am always searching the city for great chicken wings.  So far I have found a few, but mostly not so great.  These wings fell right on par with the others.  They were alright.  The flavor of them was very  "Franks", nothing special.  They were smaller and less meaty than other wings I have had in the city.  This might have been a problem except that I was there for all you can eat wing night, Wednesday.  I love the concept - but some meatier wings would have been better for me.  On the plus side, the location is fun, the place is really cute and fun, and the staff were really nice.  They were responsive when I ordered more wings - which I did several times and in the end I really had a fun time.
A suggestion to getting the most out of All You Can Eat Wing Night.  I ordered wings the same way I order Jack and Cokes at the Blackjack tables in Vegas.  When the shapely cocktail waitress brings you a drink order another right then.  Then you are never without a drink - or in this case wings.  
We sat upstairs out of the wind - but on those warm nights I bet sitting out on the street would be extra fun and when that night arrives - worth another trip.
author: Bill G.

description: If you are craving for some hot wings, this is a great place to go.  I've only gotten takeout on the buffalo wings and garlic fries so I can't speak to the burgers, but I've always been happy with the wings - especially for the price.  They have happy hour on the weekdays where you can get half-priced wings, which is a great deal.  Their wings are pretty spicy, if you like it that way, unlike some places where the sauce can be kind of weak. :-)
author: Elizabeth L.

description: YUMMY!!! Best hamburger I had in a LONG time.  Perfect size, not too big, not too small...very juicy and fresh.  When I say the hamburger meat was "fresh" I mean it did not have that weird been sitting on the grill or fridge long.  They were just really flavorful!!  The bun was actually really soft and good too!  Meat was also not greasy.  I also ordered onion rings...they were good, not great since we did take out.  I bet if we at there the onion rings would have been better.  The husband and I also chowed down on their HOT wings...oh yeah they were hot and they were good with the blue cheese dressing.  A great hidden little gem and so happy to find a place now for great hot wings and burger when the craving hits!!
author: Pam P.

description: good delivery time. i order from here all the time due to decent prices and consistent delivery time. As hard as they try there is always something that doesnt taste right about these burgers. Gotta givethem props on the fries but the taste of those burgers haunt me through every drunken bite.
author: Joshua D.

description:
New burger joint just half a block from my place of business-
I ordered their Western Burger & some (homemade) chips- the chips were pretty good, considering it's really the first time I've ever found  a place that make their own, rather than relying on the fat-filled Frito-Lay monopoly- They are getting better at making these as days go by, and the hot sauce that comes on your wings makes a nice dip for the chips as well.
The burger itself was a tad smaller than the burgers round the corner at Flippers, but as the last time I went to Flippers is gonna be the last time I EVER eat there (thanks to the 2 cockroaches in my breakfast platter!)- this place actually beats out Flippers for Price. What sells at Flipper for 10 bucks you can get here for 6. And I think they actually  do a better job of grilling the meat, tho the burger is not quite so thick and wide as Flipper's, &  there's no acoutrement of salad on your plate- but - (big but) for no frills, this was not bad. The burger had all that (ALL the fixings) on it. And no roaches either!
The salads are good but they ought to give you a larger container of dressing- somehow there's just not enough to really get the greens all wet, since they load it up with a good healthy dose of them...
Their real problem is space. Not a lot of it considering the amount of business they are getting at the lunch hour, which means a longer wait if you are upstairs, perhaps, but then it's interesting eating there- just a little cramped I would say.
The hot wings are pretty good, and since I like hot wings that'll make you sweat, these really did the trick. I can only imagine what the "Inferno" wings will do for you...
author: Mark L.

description:
Well well I had dinner here last night and yes it has taken me til today to think of how to describe my visit.  We had a all cousin dinner and all 19 of us took up the upstairs of the restaurant.  It was very clean as we had 6 kids with us.  On to the food.  

Since there was so many of us we were able to order burgers, wings and several sides.  Since I wanted to try both the burger and the chicken buger I shared with my cousin (I know which one..well one of them that was there) and my sister.  The California Burger...very tasty (they use NIman Ranch beef) and just the way I like it.  With melted swiss and creamy avocado.  I definitely didn't have to add anything else to it ie. ketchup.  The California Chicken....i know same thing as the regular burger.  Hey I gotta give myself an opportunity to come back to try the other burgers here.  The chicken was very good and juicy.  Most places with chicken burgers they usually come out dry but definitely not here.  Definitely a must if you are a white meat lover.  

Hmmm..now the wings or the sides.  Let's go with the sides..I would need more time to think of how to describe the wings.  The garlic fries were really good...there was garlic bits all over the top.  Definitely don't eat this if you are planning on kissing anyone after.  The chips very also very good.  The kids were definitely fighting for this.  We will definitely order 3 and not 2 the next time.  Now the onions rings were also another good side to have.  Yes they look exactly the way they are in the picture.  The batter was perfect and fried to perfection.  We also had a regular fries but I assume they were almost like the garlic ones...what kind of aunt would I be if I fought the kids for it.  

Now onto the buffalo wings mild, hot or inferno.  I tried all three.  I started with the hot and boy was it spicy.  I can definitely eat spicy but my goodness my mouth was on fire after my first wing.  Good thing I had a pint of Hef to kind of kill the fire.  Then I tried a mild...I know wrong order the hot got too spicy after a while.  There was a little spiciness but definitely a good choice if the hot is too hot.  Then 3 of us crazy ones decided to try the inferno since one of my cousins had previously tried it.  After half of a wing he couldn't talk.  So what I did was i licked it first and my whole mouth was burning.  Then I took a bite and I was on fire.  Chugging my Hef I just jammed the rest of the wing in my mouth and lived with the burning and drank the rest of my beer.  I think my tummy ached after from the inferno wing.  I will definitely come back again for the hot and mild wing but don't know if I am brave enough to eat the inferno one again.  

Definitely a great wing and burger joint and another plus they deliver.  I have already sent some of my friends here to try it.  You definitely won't be dissappointed.
author: Allison T.

description: Good garlic fries and ok burger... that's it simple and sitting upstairs not so nice of a feel... so 3 stars for good garlic fries and an ok cheese burger. Not sure I would go back though...
author: Chris D.

description: A decent spot, nothing too memorable. The chicken sandwich was hearty, and you could tell they put a lot of effort into making sure it was grilled just right. But I found the prices a little steep considering they didn't come with any sides, and the menu lacked other healthier options like a turkey burger. They do offer veggie, but it was just your standard Gardenburger,
author: Jason B.

description: Was looking forward to catching the second half of a world cup match all morning and so swung by this joint for lunch as they graciously broadcast matches in both of their eating areas (1 star). Ordered the fries and promptly made my way upstairs to indulge in some futbol madness. Unfortunately the fries came w/ a side of hair clump. Not a strand but a horse-fly sized clump of hair w/ middle finger sized wings. Uncool. Can't understand how they could have missed that and also can't be sure if it simply was an F-you for only ordering fries or what. I did get a replacement fries but man was that terrible.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description: i would have never sought this place without a fine rec from a friend living in the hood.  the unassuming spot is attached to the day's inn.  i was skeptical when i first arrived, but friends do not judge a book by its cover.  it's a tiny corner spot, but the burgers are well worth.  i'm not sure about the bad service, but they were uber attentive and were persistent about busing the table when we left.  i had the western burger (bacon, cheese and bbq sauce).  yums!  the garlic fries were chock full of garlic.  i was sad i was missing happy hour which starts at 3pm.  $2 tap pints!!!
author: Sharlene C.

description:
desperate to find the PERFECT fix for my wing craving, i yelped the best wings in the city--and alas--DOUBLE DECKER. 

Let me tell you--it did not disappointed...at all. we called in an order for a dozen and a half (thinking it would be a side dish to pizza). after asking them to split our order between their three flavors (inferno, hot and mild), they mentioned it would take between 30-45min to deliver from their hayes valley joint to my nob hill home (which requires a 15$ minimum, fyi). 

IMAGINE MY SURPRISE when 25 minutes in, the delivery man arrives with warm wings. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. plenty of sauce, meaty and a couple of blue cheese dippers (hey, and some celery sticks too!) my partner-in-crime and i downed them all in no more than 5 minutes. no conversation. no tv. just wing-suckling (too much?!) 

must admit--my lips are a little tingly from the inferno sauce...but nothing a nice cold beer can't cure! 

for timely service, deliciously saucy wings and a post-scarfing feeling of satisfaction, i definitely give it 5 stars!
author: Christiana R.

description: If you are in the mood for a cheap burger and some really good garlic fries, this is the place to go. One of my absolute favorite places to eat.
author: Bradley S.

description: I want to start this review by making an important distinction.  There are, in my mind, two kinds of burger.  On one hand, you have the homestyle burger like your mom used to make - an inch thick, maybe grilled on the barbecue.  This is a delicious kind of burger, like the kind you get at Zeitgest or Bender's.  On the other hand, there is the old-fashioned hamburger stand kind of burger, ala In-N-Out, delicious, but in an entirely different way.  Double Decker is of the second sort, and it is magnificent.  To risk heresy, it's better than In-N-Out.  Greasy, American Cheese, onions in the meat.  And the fries are great too.  And the building is a throwback.  I mean, it's in the Days Inn in Hayes Valley.  Did you even know there was a Days Inn in Hayes Valley?
author: John L.

description: Holy shit, this place is AMAZING! The burgs are delicious, those fries are garlicky crispy perfection, and c'mon... there are two levels. I ONLY eat at restaurants with two stories, give me a break.  Have the dude turn off the football game, turn on some sweet KMEL jams, and enjoy some discreet people watching while you booze. Excellent.
author: carineve u.

description: Great food and great prices! When I call in an order for pickup my order is always ready when I get there. What more can you ask for!? I've heard their happy hour is good too, but I have yet to check it out.
author: Janelle M.

description: If you could measure how good the wings were by measuring the amount sweat dripping off my face, then the wings must have been a joint venture sent down from the likes of God, Krishna, Allah, Buddha and Santa Claus because I had sweat enough to cure California of its 3 year drought.  This place is one of those SF institutions which almost leaves you scratching your head because the location is so odd.  It's connected to a Days Inn with a small nondescript sign in front.  But don't let that discourage you.  This place is legit. The wings were as good as advertised.  They had a respectable amount of heat, were nice and crunchy on the outside, and juicy on the inside.  It's a small family run joint, which I'm always a sucker for.  A small but good selection of beer on tap, plus happy hour from 4-6 also helps to make this place a little gem.
author: Gary L.

description: Love it....Love it....Love it....we now have a new lunch place for work....I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad....very good...but everyone else ordered the burgers, onion rings and chips....next time I will too!  I heard the wings were delicious!
author: Nancy P.

description: I work right near Double Decker, so my boss offered to take me to lunch one day and we ventured in here.  Straight out, the place looks like its a part of the hotel, its a little weird!  You order downstairs but you can sit upstairs (where they bring your meal) and eat in peace!  Hands down, this place has an amazing veggie burger!  The home-made chips are really great and the onion rings round out the meal making one incredible burger joint!  I am a stickler on veggie burgers and home-made chips but these were super good and I would go back in a heartbeat!  Not expensive, quick and easy!  I love it and so should you!
author: Allison G.

description:
my friend had a hankering for burgers one day, and he wants to try something new.  i like old and reliable, so i protest, and hop on yelp for a review.  they had me at "in the parking lot of a days inn."

we both order the regular cheeseburger and, because we can't pass up a wing no matter what else it on the plate, the 3 wing/small order of homemade chips side.  i cannot tell you how the burger tasted, though i assume it was delicious.  all i can remember are those 3 tender, juicy wings, smothered in hot sauce, dipped in bleu cheese dressing, and being shoved rapidly in my mouth in a manner that will ensure no one ever procreates with me.  well, technically i remember the chips, but only because they were coated in some of that left over sauce.

truly these wings are from heaven. they are, in fact, the only way that i know for sure that there is a god.  i make this proclamation now:  the only way there could be a better hot wing is if god himself came down from heaven, mixed up his own hot sauce, hand-dipped the wings of chickens created expressly for this purpose in the aforementioned sauce, and lovingly fried each to perfection.  as it is, the guys who own the place have come close.

and the owners are awesome in their own right.  they are possibly the friendliest guys i have ever met (granted, i hang out with a lot of d-bags), and they are always willing to go the extra mile to make sure your dining experience is a pleasant one.  

if you can't tell, i love double decker enough to marry it.  but if i can't do that, i can at least convince y'all to try it.  in that vein, please note that double decker serves beer.  and i think ice cream, but who has room for that after wings and rings (my order of choice), especially on "all you can eat wing wednesday."  yes, i did just type that.

p.s.  word to the wise:  those guys are not messing around with that inferno sauce.  word on the street is, it was in development for 2 weeks with the goal of placating every dude who ever said his hot wings weren't hot.  mission.  accomplished.  proceed with extreme caution.
author: sarah w.

description: Hrm, maybe it's the great contrast between DD and Zoya, but I finished my burger full, but disappointed.  It was nothing special.  The fries were fresh (think Nathan's style crunch but cut more traditionally) but there wasn't anything that stood out about the burger.  Next time, I'll go to Flipper's.  That place dresses quality beef up nicely.
author: ben y.

description: Went there a few months ago. Super tiny place, with super great burgers.  They were doing a large order for someone when I stopped in, but that didn't seem to slow my order much.
author: Jason S.

description: As with any place that serves food with "heat ratings" the inferno is always mild the hot is always laughable and the mild is ketchup...so i called in for lunch and ordered the wings and chips asked for the inferno and picked up a vitamin water to hydrate me after the walk back to the office...as i sit and bite into the first wing i noticed a slight tingle and from there i had another wing and another...after the third wing my mouth was an inferno!!! thanks double decker!!! you made me cry twice once because i was sooo happy the wings were "as advertised" and once because damn it those wings were hot!!!! needless to say im glad i had that vitamin water, but i needed to get a rice krispy treat and a chocolate milk to cool the flames once that was gone (by the way- rk treat and choco milk after is a good call...try it)
author: rajan e.

description:
Yumm. Quality meat and they make extra thick shakes like a boss. And to that Alice chick, wtf? Mix in the shakes? I thinks not. If you watch them make it (which is damn easy considering it's open kitchen and you'd have to work not to notice), you'd see the ICE CREAM they pull out and put into the blenders which are on the counter 3 feet from the tables. 

Friendly peeps, too. It's like man heaven whenever I go there, which makes me laugh. MANLY meat. Only regret is that the burger meat is a lil thin, but whatevs. 

As for it being next to a days inn... you should always bring your own class.
author: ascheras g.

description: I found this with my Yelp application. It was difficult to find but had decent food. I like the Nimen Ranch burger on toasted bun. It was above average. The garlic fries were ok--not the best or worst. The hot wings were definitely spicy. The ranch was just normal purchased ranch. I'd say go during the week night happy hour as my burger, garlic fries, soda and six wings came to just under $20. The advertised HH prices seemed good so I'd say go during that time.
author: Chris H.

description: ok, it's back to 50% off at happy hour. that means 6 wings, garlic fries, and a pint of heff for $6. not bad!
author: Andrew T.

description: Went here back in early March on a Saturday around 11 am ish after foolishly trying to come here on a Weds night for all-you-can-eat wings (the parking gods were not with us that day). The wings were good, but man they were TINY. I could have eaten 2 dozen of those by myself. I felt sorry for the guys who came with us cause they were still pretty hungry afterward Good thing we ordered burgers to help fill us up.
author: Jen S.

description: For being a hole in the wall burger joint, I was really surprised by the quality of their food.  They use Niman Ranch USDA prime beef (sustainable, antibiotic/hormone free) in all their burgers.  Produce for the burgers is all freshly cut to order and even though the chicken wings aren't my type as they taste a little vinegary to me, I watch the employees shake them in wing sauce before every order.  The frys and chips both are homemade and taste fresh and clean (good frying oil) and the beer is decently priced.  With the all you can eat wings Wednesdays and the happy hour on weekdays from Three to Six, Double Decker is certainly someplace to get a stress free, high quality burger, beer, and sides without having to go through the time and trouble of being seated and served.
author: Paige C.

description: I love this place.  I've only ever ordered for delivery.  Burgers, outstanding.  Garlic fries and onion rings, yum!  Service is fast and the drivers are courteous and friendly.
author: Ann G.

description: Random joint attached to a Day's Inn. Very tasty burgers that aren't too big or too meaty. More importantly, the beers were 3 bucks and it wasn't happy hour. I was happy.
author: Andy L.

description: they do have killer wings ,not too saucy or messy doesn't get all over your face, the burger good i can say pretty close to the super duper one , , garlic fries were just ok , overall good hangover place i would call it , those wings are a winner  for sure .
author: NAEL K.

description: Good burger. Really weird location. I went upstairs to eat and came back downstairs because it was so eerily quiet.
author: Ben S.

description: This place has your general staple of mediocre takeout food. I found the garlic fries to be not so good, though the wings were decent. As for the cobb salad, what the hell? There was no bacon or at least ham in it. That's not a cobb salad! Delivery service was an overall good experience, and you can do it all online on GrubHub.
author: Michael G.

description:
5:00 pm: working on my closing argument for an upcoming mock trial competition. watching the pro-bowl.  although it isn't really 'football' i get a hankering for some football food (read: greasy, fatty, life-shortening). san francisco doesn't have any good delivery pizza so that is out of the question. hmmm.... wings and garlic fries sound wonderful.

5:30 pm: call double decker and place my order. 

5:55 pm: food arrives at my door. quick delivery ftw.

6:10: food is devoured and i am yelping my success.

the garlic fries are really really good. i know that tomorrow i will most likely stink of garlic but i do not care in the slightest. it was well worth it.

the wings are good, not great. you have to ask for them well done or else the skin is not going to have that crisp crunch (unless of course you like soggy wings, in which case, gross).  

i have ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich in the past and thoroughly enjoyed it.  

so, to summarize: good food, quick delivery, cheap. i will continue to order from this place until they give me a reason not to.
author: Jason B.

description: Love it! Double Decker pwns Original Buffalo Wings &Flipper's. Why ? It's near my house, great food, great service, all you can eat wings on Weds, &happy hour!
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: I had the Hamburger, fries and strawberry milkshake. It was okay but I've had better. I thought the meat was a little too dry. But I love the shake! Seems like a better place to go for their wings and beer.
author: Jessica L.

description: I had lunch here today for the first time and the place was clean, neat and kinda simple.  The service was fast and good.  I ordered the Double Decker with grilled onions and they didnt even charge for that.  At Slider's they charge like $1.50 i think for that.  ALso had the Garlic Fries which were ass kickin strong like they sposed to be.  Maybe better than the Ball park garlic fries???? thats cuz I like em crispy and sometimes the Ballpark ones are not.  I tried some of my friends onion rings which were good as well.  Washed it all down with a Mitchells Choc Shake which was hella thick using 3 big scoops of ice cream and little milk.  Price wasnt too bad either.  Oh, they also have free delivery with $15 order. And "All you can eat Buffalo Wings" .  Gotta check this place out and try for yourself.
author: gordon g.

description: Still the best wings I have had in SF.  The chips when ordered there are wonderful.  not a big fan of delivery from there, but then fresh hot wings are the way to go!!!  Still awesome happy hour.  Tried the Double Decker burger and was satisfied.  The meat is very tender and was a very eye appealing burger.  The California?  Chicken Sandwich with the avocado and cheese and grilled chicken breast.  Also worth trying.  But those damn wings!!  Its worth the ring sting.  Its worth the trip.  I like the vanilla Mitchell's ice cream shakes.  The people there know me by face and always have a smile for me.  The happy hour specials are amazing.  The garlic fries are very garlicy and tasty.
author: Jerry V.

description: We ordered the Buffalo Wings (hot), Western Burger, Buffalo Chicken Burger (mild), the garlic fries, and a strawberry milkshake. The wings were really tasty. Although my friend thought that they were already very spicy, I'm trying inferno next time! The burgers were also delicious and flavorful. The fries were smothered in garlic, which we thought was awesome because we LOVE garlic. The milkshake was thick and creamy...and proved to be a perfect ending to the feast. The people who work at Double Decker are really friendly and efficient. No complaints. Great place!
author: bronwyn h.

description: Went here after seeing some good reviews on yelp. We were pretty disappointed. Mediocre wings and my not very cheap Cobb salad consisted of some lank lettuce in a plastic box with a small amount of cheese and a tiny bit of avocado served with a very synthetic overly sweet dressing. We didn't have a burger, maybe this is where they improve.
author: Dave H.

description:
i've lived in the sf bay my entire life, and i've never had the full "tourist" experience. so i thought one day, i would be a good tourist and put on my khaki shorts, my camera around my neck and strap my fanny pack on my waist. as i was walking, i saw a sign for double decker (perfect tour!) and naively walked in. as my initial confusion faded away, i noted to give the place a try anyways.

 a few days later...

GREAT FOOD! i think that this place is great for a quick bite...and if you're looking to eat some calories for the day. it's also a great place to avoid crowds....i would imagine this place to be amazing after a few drinks! it's all american goodness.

TIP:
it's a tiny little place, so if you're looking for a place to sit + burger, i would recommend walking up the street to Hayes and planting yourself at Flippers.
author: stephanie q.

description: They have no idea how to make chicken wings - a combo of asian wings and buffalo hot wings, but both mediocre. Way too crispy and mild was tangy at most. Frozen TGI Friday wings at Walgreens are better and cheaper... Wished they had been better.
author: Ricardo L.

description:
just went to this place last sunday, which is surprising since i live half a block away, and they've been open for a month or so now.  i ordered take-out - the california chicken sandwich & small order of onion rings, and really enjoyed it.

*  i don't normally order chicken sandwiches b/c in my previous experience with them, they're usually dry, HOWEVER, this one was great!  it wasn't dry, nor was it too thick of a piece (which is why i think some places dry theirs out since they have to cook longer).
* onion rings - i don't think i've ever had bad onion rings, and these were quite good - crispy outside, and succulent cooked onion inside.  the only thing i would note to them is to provide a sauce besides just ketchup or mustard (i.e., bbq sauce, ranch dressing).

just a suggestion:  having the option of substituting turkey instead of ground beef for their burgers.  it doesn't state they do on their menu, and i didn't ask (since i decided to take a chance and order the chicken sandwich), but assumed they didn't offer it.  most burger places i've been to do.

i look forward to trying their buffalo wings and fries next...especially the fries since my favor always goes toward a place that can serve killer fries!
author: Kelly T.

description: Delicious wings, cheap beer, tasty onion rings, it is great. Come for happy hour for $1.50 pints! A hidden gem of casuality in the middle of SF, I highly recommend it.
author: Brett H.

description: Today my co workers and i wanted to dive in to a new spot around civic center and we came across double decker online so decided to dive in, and we were impressed with the service and food.
